review: This game's history for me has been a wild and long one. When I first got this game for the PC I immediately started installing mods. If you have never installed mods on GTA before then you're missing out on something big darling. If you have trouble not knowing what to do after downloading mods (like I did) then just search up a guide. Once you have installed mods this game is a blast!!! It's the most fun I think you'll get out of this game. Now let's talk about online.. how should I put this??? If you're not making a private lobby then don't even bother trying online because it's pointless. Every and I mean EVERY online lobby has A hacker or a bunch of hackers in it trying to drop you money (which will basically guarantee in a ban) or just troll the hell out of you until you leave. Also the cars in online are expensive AF. I do not recommend buying shark cards since their just a waste of money. Actually... everything costs alot online. All in all I still recommend this game because of the wide range of mods. But I do not recommend going online.

review: Single player is great and took loads of time to complete. There where many missions to do and the collectables took a long time to find. Unfortunately a lot of the collectables where put in the oceans encouraging players to explore the ocean. The problem is that there is not fast way to explore the ocean and you will waste many hours attempting to 100% this game while traveling slowly in the dark. Not the best gameplay. Rockstar should have spent less time developing the oceans and more time creating interiors that you could go into and visit.The online side of the game is a bit mixed. Sometimes you will come across hackers that will ruin it for you. Spontaneous explosions and launching your car into the sky as you are driving around. Mix this with people whose only goal is to slay other players and this leads to what isn't exactly the best online experience. However you can host private lobbies by yourself or with friends if you do not wish to deal with those types of players.Overall the game is a good purchase and I got plenty of play time from it.Edit They have added loads of content including interiors for buildings and new vehicles since this review was first written. Unfortunately most of this content is hidden behind paywalls that require hours of grinding to access. Or you can buy in game money with real money... typical Rockstar...

review: I congratulate a fantastic effort from Rockstar I thankfully didn't have the same troubles with GTAV that I had with the highly unoptimised GTAIV the creators do seem to have put some effort into making the PC version.Game The story mode is a fresh take on the GTA series with the control of three very different characters in the setting of the alive and vibrant San Andreas city and its surrounding areas which always has something to see and do.Graphics As expected the graphics are great and look wonderful pushes my card and machine to its limit which is refreshing to see a game that doesn't shy away from using up memory.Audio I don't know if it's just me but the radio stations seem shorter than previously I sometimes feel I've heard the same track/talk several times during a play session. The other audio around the city is very immersive.Online A new and very welcomed feature does need a bit of ironing out as even with an SSD in my system the loading times are LOOOOOONG and sometimes frustrating especially when you sit for 5 mins waiting to join a game then it times out and kicks you back to the normal game without so much as a retry? question then you have to begin the whole process again irritating!Overall I'm enjoying my time with GTAV and not feeling the sting of paying so much money for a game (first time I've paid a full price like that in a long time!) it's just a shame that Rockstar didn't show the PCMasterRace some love and release the same time as the peasants!

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Ok first I have to say Why don't you already have this game? And secondly if you do own the game and are just reading the reviews for chuckles hello!The city of Los Santos lays spread out in a low lying basin of southern San Andreas along the Pacific Ocean. Smog ridden streets are ripe with crime from small time drug dealing to upscale corportate and even intragovernment illegality. The city wastes away in a unique bath of bitterness regret paranoia fear and loathing.This is where the action film was born. The romance. The drama. The tragedy. And this is where they've all come to die.The Overall ReviewGTA V and Online make up the 15th/16th installment of the GTA series that began back in 1997. Holding many records awards and controversies GTA is no stranger to anybody anywhere near the gaming culture.There's no real backstory or major inter game plots that are need to know. Pick any title up and go it'll all unfold itself quickly. GTA V is no different.GameplayThe open world is massive and fun to explore though not with the interactability of some other popular open world titles. Plenty of area to drive fly and boat around in.Vehicle handling is weighty but not too uncontrollable unlike previous GTA installments. Each vehicle handles differently depending on build bigger cars are slower in speed and steering response some bikes can't do wheelies high wing planes handle differently from low wings. Mods can be purchased for smaller vehicles that improve statistics as well as cosmetics.Gunplay is satisfying if a little finnicky to get used to. Drawing and cover based fire are sluggish aiming can be bothersome when switching between different weapons. Plenty of variety in weapon selection though and the way it's handled is more streamlined than previous GTAs. There's a central weapon wheel and the player may carry any weapons they own at all times.Player movement can feel sluggish weighty. Moving a player character can be a real chore at times due to the way the game reacts so snappily to input but is slow on actual movement. Combat rolls and climbing over objects of reasonable height make for fun exploration and interesting tactics.StoryGTA V's story is solid. Three protagonists all controlled at will by the player play as major agents in criminal doings all around Los Santos and Blaine County. Heists that can be planned are a high point while there are plenty of diversions of both legal and illegal varieties available beyond the main plot. It can grow weary at times like most Rockstar titles in the way each character is led around and forced into plenty of situations that just aren't fun and this can affect the player's own experience.The plot borrows from many popular action films and so many tropes occur. GTA is nothing without satire and parody but it will still glorify all the explosions and absurd amounts of violence it's inspirations portray. Be prepared for lots of shooting and driving.GTA Online's story is... is there a story? Sort of. There's a meaningful chain of missions around the lower levels linking characters from V to Online but this fades out later as the CEO VIP MC and other "occupation" systems come into play. It's very much the same as V though action movie made interactive.VisualsTo be honest for a game now in it's second generation after having originally released in 2013 GTA V is still very beautiful. It remains true to the slightly surreal but oh so detailed art of previous GTA installments so everybody you see in the game is a little weird looking but it's all very well modeled and thought out (except for maybe the engine models for most cars).There are some problems with the graphical settings mentioned below. The majority of the game is very pretty even at low settings and at the highest settings it can be stunning. Smaller details regardless of the graphics can be found in sound effects or animations metal cooling in cars after they're shut off little twitches and subtle shifts in body language of character models to create a heavy layer of reality overtop the zany satire ridden world.Online InteractionsThe most hit and miss part of GTA V/Online. As with any online multiplayer game the quality of fellow player is going to be across the board. Most of the time playing missions or heists players will atleast be competent enough to get the job done. Trolls will appear.Online's playerbase also suffers from a huge amount of cheaters exploiters and otherwise manipulators of the game to ruin it for other people. Do not be surprised if a whale falls out of the sky onto your shiny new super car then you get teleported into a room with everybody else on the server and are gunned down instantly by an astronaut with a minigun.There are different types of sessions for solo friend only crew only and invite only play to avoid the general community but the usefulness of these lobby types have diminished as updates have locked away more and more content to public only lobbies in an attempt to force a challenge upon players.Money is always a huge part of GTA but in Online it's what makes the entire world go around. Cars guns houses and even playing most jobs costs the player cash. This has ratcheted up since the PC release as prices grow higher and higher as more ways to make money are introduced. At the same time however for a casual player this typically means they'll never use many of the features later updates have included. For a new player it can be very overwhelming and rather negative to their experience as a whole.Problems Bugs and HeadachesOh yes. GTA V and Online have... problems. Singleplayer is typically sturdy but as any game does some issues persist. Mostly with the physics engine sometimes having weird hard stops or ragdolls and bodies not reacting properly to forces. The anti aliasing is unreliable as well as the anisotropic filtering.Online suffers from random bad connections timeouts and the aforementioned lack of anti cheat. Players report lots of abrupt disconnects annoyingly long loadtimes and weird transaction problems when it comes to in game purchases. Aaaand of course lag! Since its all peer to peer most connections with other players rely on the strength of one player's own connection and if this fails it can cause lots of drop outs.The VerdictGTA V and by extension Online are lots of fun. Worth thousands of hours of playtime just for how much fun it can be doing anything from playing the story to goofing off with friends to just hiking around the map alone.While it's definitely true the overall experience can be dragged down to an absolute stand still by jerks in Online or the tedium of doing a mission over and over after you've died the sixth time there's lots more to be doing in a game like GTA V. I recommend this game not denying it's faults but deciding that they are outweighed by the greatness all around.My verdict? Get GTA V if you haven't already. And really why haven't you?

review: Fun while it lasted but after 1300 hours playing I have hit my limit. Why? The Oppressor Mk II. It is all anyone plays now to PVP. It comes down to timing on the fire button and that's about it. The game would be better balanced without it. The first Oppressor was already a killer and took finesse to get it to work right. The Mk II is overkill.As far as the rest of the game goes it's a huge timesink to get a few toys that are great fun. It had it's charm for a while but they put far too much time into this new dance club that doesn't make you much money and is more geared towards recording your dance moves. Oh joy.

review: As an online game? Hell no.As an offline game? For sure!A lot of people are saying negative comments regarding the online portion of the game such as Toxic community The unlimited number of hackers/modders The lack of actual players when you create an activity lobbyHowever let's not forget this series was originally meant to be a single player game. The story is good the graphics are nice and the attention to small details are amazing. This is a huge sandbox where you can mess around for hours even when you are not actively following the main story line.If you are someone who is looking for a decent online game I suggest you look elsewhere as what you have heard regarding this game is probably true. However if you are looking for a decent open world single player game this is something that should not be missed.

review: Product received for free. ("Product Recieved for Free" I was gifted the game by another steam user.)I've played GTA V a lot since I was given it and with the steam awards I decided to review the game.TL DR Singleplayer is great online is a mixed bag get the game on saleThe graphics are great even decent with a low medium end computer.The singleplayer is excellent I'm not done with the story but currently I'm enjoying it.Although something I do have to cover with this review is the online mode.Online is very different from singleplayer. There's a bunch of high tech veichles some examples include a DeLorean hoverbikes solar powered trucks that can customize hoverbikes and many more.The online communtiy is pretty bad imo (of course there's good people but...) there's a large grinding mechanic in the game that these tryhards and straight up trolls abuse to ruin other people's days you can be waiting for 8 HOURS for something to produce only for it to be blown up by a guy in a fighter jet. Lower levels are killed over and over again because people think that their K/D ratios actually matter thinking that they're playing Call of Duty Black Ops 4 Battle Royale mode and want to show off to all their friends that they're decent at the game.Quick word of warning also The rockstar team will actually ban players that get DROPPED money BY hackers without hacking themselves. I haven't experienced this myself tho.Online is also a grind fest if you are not into that you may not enjoy it I myself enjoy the grinding (as long as my stuff doesn't get destroyed by tryhards).Get the game while its on sale is my opinion the game never really goes below 34% off.

review: I guess rockstar doesn't really care what's happening with the multiplayer anymore... The SP remains good as it was made by competent Rockstar. But the MP got ed up beyond repair. It all happened somewhere around 2017 when they started adding crazy vehicles that didn't belong in GTA at all. Now you're at the point where you're trying to collect cargo from a misson where normally no other player should be involved but you're being chased by multiple flying motorcycles which can shoot large amounts of homing missles at your unbelievably vurnurable and slow moving car. I don't know how it happened but somehow everyone has the flying missle shooting bike now. You're at the point where you're just looking for an online server with only 5 or less people. Way to go multiplayer. Rockstar tries to keep a large playerbase by giving you free money on certain moments but the reason everyone leaves this game is because of the dull missions and the crazy overpowered vehicles that kill you over and over and over AND OVER again. The multiplayer has become an unbelievable game of pay to win (or cheat to win) and it's annoying as . If that isn't enough there are hackers in every server. If you're not getting griefed by O.P. vehicles you will spontaneously catch fire or explode by hackers. It's like Rockstar doesn't even care about this. No actions are being taken to reduce hackers. It's really bad. The multiplayer will leave you frustrated tired and probably pretty angry too. Maybe even so angry that you start writing a nagative review. off Rockstar. You ed up one of the best games out there and instead of learning from your mistakes you make things even worse. It's insulting to the entire gaming community.

review: While the game is definatly good there are bad parts to it (focusing on Online). There is a large grind and more veteran players will easily destroy you and there is little you can do about it as a low level no matter how skilled you are. Then there are hackers who are pretty much the same situation but nobody can really defeat them if the hackers care enough. My advice is to try and find a session with only a few players and whenever something gets sketchy in the slightest switch sessions. This will avoid most hacking since this prevents giving them time to mess with you. Overall a fun game especially with friends but be prepared for a grind and some dissapointment or frustration. Especially since the AI seems programmed to get in your way by doing completely random and nearly unpredicatible things constantly. At its now reduced price it is more worth it than before but still beware of what you are getting into.

review: Bought this on sale for 19.99 it's alright... After review and many many hours spent testing here are my results and summary. The pc verison does look great however for some of us friendly modders who want to make story mode awesome (cause forget online) Rockstar doesn't seem to agree. Updates. Updates Updates they are still havng the smallest updates kill every mod ususally config built. The latest to 1.4.xxxx blah blah. Installing cars skins houses boats enb graphics and what knot mods can crash. You can get error messages from having 3 mods or 30 installed after small recent update I was closer to 50 overall mods(took a long time to get this collection) yet issues after the updates. I've spent a well 50hrs trying to get everything to play nice. Storylines still stable testing(most stable I've had it). Rockstar needs to get right off that high horse and understand what kind of possibilties they could have here if they allowed strong modding to take place with a creation kit or more offline support. Because a vanilla GTA is just boring as hell like shoot Rockstar how many years and no actual chop shops bank robbing on story mode? I have two key mods installed low life crimes that makes people drop their wallets and crack safes put a safe in every robable store and another mod to mark those stores like..... WTF ROCKSTAR. WALK AWAY FROM THIS FRANCHISE. Terrible job Rockstar and most big league games now a days. You should pay 14.99 for this...or less.

review: I bought this game to play GTA Online with a friend so I'm going to review it for GTA Online. Got it on sale for $20 but given the aggressive monetization it could almost have been f2p. Rockstar wouldd just need to change it to have a premium currency and have a few things purchasable only with that premium currency and then it would be indistinguishable from a f2p game. There's a big grind for anything and the only way I got a good amount of money was from Rockstar giving free handouts. The main things that got money were jobs and heists. Jobs give more than nothing but not much at all and hard heists give more but still not nearly as much as I'd like. There are evidently other special things that are the best for grinding money when you have a nightclub or some other high level building but I haven't tried those since the initial investment is so expensive. One other thing is challenges where you compete with others in the session to do challenges like "drive the furthest without hitting anything". You don't get much from them but considering how much time it takes and that it doesn't take a loading screen I actually like it compared to jobs and heist pay outs. Compared to buying something expensive it isn't much though. Aside from that you could mess around but you don't get money for messing around pushing you to do jobs or heists. Then when you do a job it sometimes takes forever to get a good amount of people though heists are fine for people since you just need 4. Loading times are absolutely horrible I've heard it might be syncing the open world but that doesn't change the fact that the loading times are painfully long. Besides loading for jobs and heists are also bad and I can't imagine they require syncing anything. Specifically loading in heists is bad because in hard heists if one person dies everyone has to start over again which I also don't like. I would much prefer if someone dies the rest of the team contines on until they win or lose. It would clash with some of the design of the heists since it will designate people on a certain team with a certain objective but I'd also like to do away with that too. The cursor is painfully laggy on menus when using mouse and keyboard though I haven't tried messing with settings to see if I can make it better. And on the subject of control your character in GTA V controls quite realistically. So in other words you don't have much control over your character. The ragdolls are fun when you are alright with it but many times the game just doesn't feel good. Some people might like it but it's not my style. My favorite TPS controls are from MGSV. Best way to have fun is when a friendly cheater comes in. Then you can try out the vehicles that are insanely expensive and also any car that is cheated in to have max acceleration and speed is wonderful. Overall there's not a whole lot that's fun. If this game had custom servers and modding support for those servers it would be very worth $30 though it does not. I would recommend buying this game only for the singleplayer though I haven't yet tried modding the hell out of it. At least to me it does sound enjoyable unlike GTA Online.Edit Also I'd highly recommend NakeyJakey's video on GTA V called "GAMES THAT SHOULD BANG Grand Theft Auto V &amp Metal Gear Solid V"

With the introduction of heists to organizations and motorcycle gangs to aerial combat and support this game just keeps evolving with the times to keep people interested. Couple that with all the online content Rockstar keeps pushing it keeps the game enjoyable and still relevant despite it's release a few years back. This games has changed its face so many times over while continuing to keep everything competitive and fun. I can't forsee a new Rockstar GTA game in a while because the amount of free DLC this game has produced is more content than some entire games. I still highly recommend it to new PC players or even those who think they'll be "late" to the game.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a very well put together game. The team keeps the game up to date and is constantly releasing new amazing updates to the game without infamous "DLC Charges". The cars are great the game runs Mostly smooth and the game modes/updates/NPC voice lines are very thorough fun and immersive. I could go on for about an hour talking about all the great things Rockstar is doing with this title. This would be my single favorite game of all time if it weren't for 1) Constant Server Disconnects when loading into/out of missions2) "Grief Theft Auto" The MKII Oppressor along with other similar vehicles result in constant griefing with 0 Player Skill required. Just get into a ridiculous over powered vehicle murder everyone and go into "Passive Mode" after you're finally shot down so you can get into another one.Side Note GTA Shark Cards are way overpriced. While I don't buy in game currency for hardly any games theyshould at least attempt to find a more generous price for in game GTA cash. Hardly anyone is going to buy a few heists worth of in game $ for $20 USD. Overall 3.8/5 StarsReasoning The server loading issues are such a frequent and prevalent nuisance that this has dropped my rating of the game by roughly a whole point. Update the servers and turn (HOMING MISSLES) OFF when targetting player vehicles and this might just be the best game on the market.

review: Ohh GTA oh Rockstar where to begin... Alright I figure I ll let most people know that I am a single player oriented gamer. Not that I don t game online all the time but an immersive single player mode is what matters the most. This is GTA V s saving grace for me. We all know the epic story of Trevor Michael and Franklin and we all know that the game offers an immense amount of content still considered almost overkill to this day. It is the closest to life simulation we ve got with added drugs money theft murder gangs hookers YOU NAME IT! . All of my hours on Steam aside from maybe 10 minutes are all offline play. This is why I still recommend the game. Also because I got my copy for $15 which seemed reasonable.Now years ago when GTA V first game out I was an Xbox 360 player. When the motorcycle bug blew up I was not one of the players who found out and I steady worked for a couple weeks to earn a few million or so. I was also amongst one of the players who had all of my money taken away from me because of Rockstar s up. That was it for me. I stopped playing online and never looked back. Since then I have heard all of the horrible treatment online players have gotten from each other and Rockstar. I would be disgusted with this title too and can t blame anyone for giving a thumbs down. But I think if you can grab the game at a low price and you decide to give up on GTA online and decide to not spend your time or money on publishers or devs who don t care then you won t find yourself that angry and you won t find yourself on the verge of sending a pipe bomb to a certain CEO. And the devs will give up because it will be a waste of their money just like it was a waste of yours.For instance at this moment Rockstar is offering around $1.2million supposed for just logging in every day for this past week. Some people are worried Rockstar won t pay. I m not. You know why? I don t give a .

review: To review GTA 5 one has to review 2 games GTA 5 (single player) and GTAO (online).GTA5 8/10 one of the best worlds created in the GTA franchise with stunning levels of detail and great game mechanics. the story is ok (starts out great but the ending seems a little sloppy)GTAO 5/10 creates sessions with 10 20 players in them and takes ages (1 10 minutes) to load (I can't understand why if you're connecting 20 players). The freemode map is mostly used for getting to missions or grinding repetitive tasks. The missions heists reaces all happen in 'private' sessions with the players that participate. The issue is that for every switch between freemode and missions you will lose 1minute on loading screens. the best part of the game is joining a crew to perform heists however 75% of the time one member of the crew will mess up (die disconnect or just play to annoy others) which will block all the crew from progressing furthermore it takes around 5 minutes to even get a crew to do a heist so you're wasting 5 minutes for a 25% chance that everyone who joined wants to play there are many other mini games which can be fun (races arena war etc) but I suspect players only do those to make game money not just for fun. finally there's a lot of content you can buy with game money like owning a business clubs bunkers etc. From what I can tell these are seen as good ways to make more game money by doing boring and repetitive tasks (move stuff from point A to B while getting attacked). I am quite sure players only do this to get more game money. why does everyone grind to get game money? Because money can be spent on buying all sorts of supercars boats outfits and ridiculous items (flying cars and bikes) to troll others. So players struggle to make some money in order to annoy others who struggle to make money.Overall I am most annoyed in GTAO by the loading times to do any fun thing and the ridiculous items added (flying cars etc) which destroy the amazing world that was created for GTA 5. But if you are persistent you may have some fun in the game. I can recommend this product on Steam even if only for the offline story mode.

review: Review will be based on two different subjects GTAV and GTA Online.GTAV Its a wonderful singleplayer experience. Characters are charming attention to detail is crazy gameplay is fun and the whole experience is good. Campaign takes quite a few hours and I only had a few missions which I disliked. (Namely the tow missions.) Solid 9/10 pick this up for singleplayer.GTA Online Its a hit or miss pun not intended if you play the game for the online aspect. Lots of cheaters which usually ruin the game and you also run the risk of getting banned for jack Also no mod support anywhere because Take Two is ing . Online is also very p2w I'm talking DarkOrbit levels of p2w. Shark Card advertisements are everywhere and everything IS SO GODDAMN EXPENSIVE. You will save money for a month just for a single vehicle or building only to regret the purchase because you will use it like two times. Online is like a 5/10 all things considered.

review: Product received for free. I was gifted this game by a friend whom I love to game with and for a few months we had some good times. I've bought the DLC a few Shark Cards (hey I work full time so don't give me crap about being a whale) and have put many hours into the game. However I cannot recommend it in its current state.There are two glaring problems in my view which Rockstar has complete control over and yet apparently refuses to address 1. Online play is completely ruined by so called "modders". These hackers are in nearly every lobby able to do all kinds of neat things to ruin your day like spawning in a Kanjali and then warping to you or forcing you to accept an invite to their apartment and blowing up the whole lobby or placing objects on your character which don't go away without a game restart. There are many other issues with this but this is just the most recent exposure I've had within the last 2 days.2. Online performance is garbage. Despite being "peer to peer" it is still heavily reliant on servers which are apparently potatos connected to the internet via a dial up baud modem. I know this reads like hyperbole but it's absurd. I have a pretty stout rig and I'm convinced the Cray super computer would choke trying to load this game or a new lobby for that matter. If these two issues were addressed by Rockstar I'd be a far happier customer. There would be other issues of course the Oppressor MkII which is so totally broken it is hard to believe any thinking individual would have green lit it as a vehicle in game griefers who hammer their angrily while blowing up your cargo for a measly $2000 or numerous other fun exploits that have existed in some form or another since the game was released. But really those top two are in their control and Rockstar apparently aren't doing a thing about it.Hope this is helpful to someone.

review: After spending 5 years (more like 4.9 since i originally got this game on 24/12/2013 and today it's the 22/11/2018) playing this game and its online mode which is gonna be your main focus after a while i just have to say i'm disappointed.I'll just start with the singleplayer The singleplayer story is fun but worse from a storytelling perspective in comparison to GTA 4 but nonetheless it's still engaging to a certain extent adding mods will help your experience and all of that as usual.And if you're looking forward to using post 2015 content in singleplayer you're out of luck unless you mod the game (but every new big update breaks the mods that let these vehicles in so have fun).Now the bad part the Online.I remember playing with my friends 5 years ago on Xbox 360 when if you had a normal 300k high end apartment and an Adder you were an absolute king among men. Fast forward to 2018 you leave your house and you get bombed by a flying bike which is locked behind 2 paywalls not to mention that literal Lada costs 180k which is now easy to get i should add. But still 100k gets you a normal sports car.Ever since Rockstar fired the original guy who had the vision for GTA Online and GTA 5 it's all just become a bad microtransaction induced fest. You can buy them to get in game money but you really shouldn't. There's no point in fueling this mess anymore.If you do have some friends though feel free to screw around in the multiplayer. The greatest fun i've had on this game is just messing around rather than doing whatever spectacular heist there is. Better yet buy this game to then play on FiveM (unofficial online client with different modes like RP or mini games etc) it's limitless there.Before i get to my final verdict i wanna talk a second about the mythical Chiliad Mistery.Rockstar what the .Why did you scrap the work of a dedicated community for money for your Online? There's people that looked into every little detail trying to get behind that mural or just at least crack the meaning behind it. All we got in the end was an overpriced (as in overpriced in game content that can be bought with in game money) DLC.Final verdict It's not as good as you think it is. When a modder burns the entire lobby or an Oppressor MK2 blows the living out of you you won't feel the need to play anymore.

review: $200 invested into this game just to get my account reset. copyfox said it best"After todays new game update you guys said "Original story I feared GTA Online would die a slow death with the arrival of Red Dead Redemption 2's multiplayer mode on consoles but it doesn't look like that's going to be the case just yet."Just no.. GTA Online died when you morons decided to make it P2P (peer to peer connection) instead of dedicated servers where ANYONE can use mods and cheats without consequences. You literally have around 10 20% of the people using mods who just mess with you when you try to do missions (putting you in cages killing you over and over again with their godlike/teleportation mode on etc). I would have bought in game money for real money if it wasn't for the cheaters. Why would I spend one dollar more on this game where other players can just download cheats and give themselves infinite money? GTA Online could have been one of the biggest if not the biggest online game if your management weren't absolutey morons. Happy you guys never became as big as Fortnite you idiots don't deserve it at all.Edit To make things clear I hate Fortnite lol. I've tried it twice uninstalled both times within 30 minutes. You can go check Twitch movies shows everyone is streaming/talking about Fortnite. Never said it was a good game but at least they try and they put out a lot of content and deal with cheaters which is why they've had big success. You can't argue against their success no matter what you think of their game. Rockstar pretends like nothing while so many cheaters are running rampart ruining everyones experience. Real shame because I really loved the game itself but I'm tired of cheaters messing with you for NO reason. Just for the attention because their life have no meaning and no one cares about them in real life. "

Decided to write this review after waiting half an hour to 'join the online session' and still failed. Repeatedly and with varying errors. The multiplayer itself is a complete nonsensical mess with invisable cars and lazor weapons hover bikes and a lot of getting killed by higher levels. (In my own experiance I headshoted a guy 4 times with a sniper rifle he doesnt die turns to me stormtroopers me and everything surrounding my nearest vicinity with a lazor weapon i die.)You CAN NOT play the game with your friend in co op.(If your looking some fun with your bud get Saints Row)The story of singleplayer leaves you with the same emotion youre left with after you finish watching a movie. Though need to admit i did crack a smile twice.

review: Grand Theft Auto V About the game The game was released on windows on 14 April 2015. The game has been made by Rockstar. Story Franklin Clinton works for a corrupt car dealer. When he has to bring a car back because the owner did not pay for it. He meets Michael. Michael is the dad of the car owner. Michael catches Franklin stealing the car back. Micheal almost died a few years ago while robbing a bank with Trevor Philips. Trevor now lives in a trailer park. Trevor sees on his tv that the car got stolen back and he thinks that must be the work from Michael. He starts looking for Michael and meets them. Together they go rob banks and more. Multiplayer The multiplayer in this game is quite good. There is a lot to do a lot of purchaseable apartments companys and vehicles. There are a lot of fun jobs like races. The multiplayrer gets updated often with new content. The multiplayer does not get bored. Mods. There are a lot of good mods with a lot of variety. Better graphics mods like Redux and NaturalVision but also zombie mods new gamemodes new missions new maps new vehicles and LSPDFR if you want to be a cop.I usually get my mods from here. gta5 mods.com Important things. You need to grind a lot for some multiplayer things. If you dont like thta you can buy shark cards but those are expensive.In multiplayer a lot of people just randomly kill you.Score +1 nice open world+5 good story mode+2 A lot of things to do+2 nice modding community 1 random RDM'ers 1 sometimes crashesAlso if you do not like the regular multiplayer experience try FiveM for custom gamemodes and roleplaying.Final score 8/10

review: Product received for free. This is by far the best Grand Theft Auto game so far especially on PC. The map of Los Santos is still pretty big almost 6 years after release. I played this on consoles as soon as it came out and as of now I own 3 versions of this game. You control 3 characters in the main story mode all with an intertwined story and seperate side missions. The characters (Michael Trevor &amp Franklin) have a great chemistry and are really likeable by the end of the game despite Trevor being a psychotic . The online mode GTA Online is also 100% free when you buy the game a welcome addition to someone who used to pay for Xbox Live making the game more replayable than ever. 9.5/10 no waluigi what the sakurai

review: Hello and if you are reading my review I hope you have a wonderful evening.Shall I begin? Alrighty! So! Rockstar.. hmm Rockstar is a complete idiotic company who strives to earn money regardless of what it's customers view. Think of Communism. You don't have any say in any decision they make and they want to always be rich and in power. Which is sadly to be expected with this type of game.I had a friend I played with online all the time we worked together to gain hard earn cash from doing heists games and other fun stuff. However he got banned. Why? because a modder came and spawned cash onto his account. He was banned for 17 years and now I work alone playing this game.I got this game in around 2015 and I loved it. Despite my terrible computer I was able to tweak this game to look good and get 60 80 FPS on 720p on an Intel HD 4600 computer with a AMD Radeon R5 M430 graphics card. Shocking! This game is awesome the story mode is amazing and its just a great game if only Rockstar cared about its customers.I still play online to this day and I would NEVER put mods onto my account it's not worth it. I've already purchased 500 000$ dollars from shark cards and sometimes I regret doing that because I don't know if that much money coming in so fast will get me banned.Just be careful. If you're new to this and want to buy it Go ahead but there are SERIOUS I mean SERIOUS things you need to consider it's a huge possible chance you may dump 30$ down the drain.Good luck mate it's all that I can say.

review: Worth it for single player but GTA online really should be free. They seem to think that lazy content updates are passable as "Free DLC" and they trick their players into thinking they are treating them with respect when in reality Rockstar knows good and well what they are doing. The single player is amazing probably the best GTA in the series seriously. The story is pretty cheesy but I think that is one of the charms of the game it is like a bad 80s film but for modern times. It also runs like a dream and still looks amazing despite being released like 5 years ago 3 for pc.I would not advise buying this game just for online because of the serious problems that have plagued it for a long time. I already mentioned the really good marketing that rockstar has used in order to trick the fanboys but I think it is equally as important if not more so to mention the insane amount of cheaters in the game. Most of the online activites are done in freemode and usually that means that you have to play with others. Honestly that is the best and yet the worst aspect of the game because open world gta pvp is amazing... when the other players aren't using jets miniguns explosive snipers flying bikes with missiles and etc. As you can see there is an extreme balancing issue in freemode and it doesn't help that ingame money can be bought with real money.The end result is boredom because open PVP is impossible and to me that ruins the whole experience. The freemode is designed around pvp but it is has been ruined by pay to win and people who have to use cheats because they are that bad. This is all said without mentioning the faulty anti cheat that Rockstar uses I have heard stories of people being banned for doing nothing luckily that hasn't happened to me yet. Overall i'd say try it and have fun but don't buy the game just for the online mode.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So I just finished GTA V today 75% complete the game after beating all the main missions and most side missions. 68 hours playtime according to Steam.GTA V was a game I was waiting for since it was first released on the 360/PS3 in 2013. I had watched my brother play a good chunk of it on his 360 and was blown away by the world design and direction but just have never been able to bring myself to play consoles regularly enough to complete any game besides the latest Zelda or Mario on Nintendo consoles.I am and have been a PC gamer for over 20 years now starting with Biomenace Wolf3d and LucasArt/Sierra adventure games in the early nineties and continuing along from there playing anything I could get my hands on my favourite experiences being immersive first person games of all genres.I have played every game in the GTA series since the beginning but really started to enjoy the series at Vice City and San Andreas.From the first time I played GTA3 I knew it would be a thousand times better in first person. This was much later confirmed for me when I played through the fourth game in the series almost entirely in the first person using an amazing mod. I even managed to play through San Andreas recently with a first person mod a few months prior to GTA V releasing on the PC it translated to the first person surprisingly well.As good as those modded experiences were they feel like tech demos compared to GTA V which I played through entirely in the first person.There are plenty of reviews that explain the story and general gameplay mechanics and in all actuality very little has changed from the early roots of the series. Missions are still started by driving to mission markers separate from the sandbox experience to some degree and involve a variety of gameplay loops that include chases shootouts or a large number of mini game activities. The story is pretty much a riff on the same notes they've touched on throughout the series with the same tired parody thrown in for good measure although it is well directed with mostly great dialog and does actually have a series of really good laughs in addition to plenty of jaw dropping action set pieces throughout the missions. Each cut scene is presented with cinematic grace that most of the time does not draw on the parody of the world you are in. In fact although all the radio adverts bill boards and brand name gags are still there they seem to play second fiddle most of the time to GTA's more subtle and real world aspirations.The first wow moment for me was when I was up near the Vinewood sign and looking off into the distance at night seeing the buildings and tiny vehicle lights in the distance and knowing that it wasn't a sky box. Knowing that at any moment I could drop what I was doing and walk or drive in any direction.Other moments include walking down an alley way and spooking a cat seeing it dash by in front of me while I looked down at the trash it had slightly disturbed settle in the corner from where it had come from or waiting for the crosswalk light during a downpour looking at the reflections in the puddles of water rapidly being disturbed by the heavy rainfall and feeling relieved when I was able to jog across in front of the slick cars lined up to my left and in front of me.Moments like these were as impressive as the actual story based gameplay moments which are as fun as ever. The mission design is heads and tales above every other open world sand box game released in the last ten years. But with the addition of a first person perspective there is a divide between what it is right now and what it could be in the next few iterations.Currently the first person perspective does nothing but provide an immersion factor to a really good action game. It is well designed and creates a feeling of solidity that almost no other game has ever felt like at least for me. The world feels random and hand crafted at the same time however the limited world interactivity leaves the game feeling plastic at times. It is worth noting that the violence does feel more impacting in the first person and often times left me feeling exhausted after missions wishing that stealth and non lethal mission alternatives were always an option instead of just a few sequences spread throughout the game where it worked for the story.There is a feeling that this could be a bigger experience a more interactive experience a less scripted experience. The world (despite not having full interiors) feels big and real in a way that most Bethesda open world experiences have felt like in fact it feels bigger because the city scale is more real than anything in the Elder Scrolls/Fallout series. This however makes it feel like I should be able to enter any building or talk to any NPC as if it were a player character driven role playing game instead of an open world action sandbox game.These are not major issues but I feel that this game is the first step forward for a modern day immersive simulation game set in a big city where you truly do have the whole city in front of you to explore and where one day maybe the story won't be a scripted narrative but a game world where the story unfolds as a consequence of player driven choice a world where violence and reckless behavior would carry weight and consequence to a degree where non violent alternatives seem like a viable option.I really do hope that RockStar try and take the first person experience further and into more interactive territory than the GTA series is traditionally known for and maybe they'll even ditch the make believe parody world and start writing stories in real world locations where attempts at satire instead of parody play into a more subtle narrative. As it sits it is a fantastic first person action experience and worthy of every hour of gameplay I put into it.Score 9.5Technically this is a brilliant game and accomplishes everything it sets out to do with incredible polish but the lack of true player choice hurts the first person experience a tiny bit. The parody humour also hinders what could be a real gritty story as it feels like a tired leftover from the series roots. Though I do have issues with some of the story and with the lack of true choice I can't argue against this being one of the most important games to come out in the last decade. It is also the first game in a long time that legitimately earned every hour of my play time as literally every minute felt fun.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player part of this gsme is amazing. Rockstar yet again creates an amazing atmosphere with plenty of side content to keep you busy after beating the main story. The environment is well done and immersive and the characters are interesting and funny. However the online portion of this game is slighly toxic. It's riddled with griefers and microtransactions. Online is really only fun if you have friends to mess around with otherwise prepare to spend money real money or have enough time to relentlessly grind.

This shows character development and forces you to make game altering decisions which I will not spoil because I am not a giant bag. You take the roles of Franklin Clinton who is just a CJ but never left LS and there is michael de santa who is a retired theif and there is trevor phillips who owns trevor industries and is a phycopath that likes to kill rednecks in blaine county. The story is one to play however the online features are not in it except for a few cars and the only way to get the cars are by modding them in which can sometimes be a little dangerous. Some of the story like the mount chiliad drawing thing is a cryptic drawing that people car far to crazy over jsut for soem views. Ok so to online...Online is pretty not gonna lie but you can also have alot of fun but screw listing the fun stuff because theres not that much.One of the first real problems that you may encounter are IGN or other crews that are infested with tryhards. for anyone who doesnt know what a gta 5 tryhard is then you have not met the worst players ever who resort to the finest military technology to kill you and yet you still beat them cause they suck. review: Overall very fun but online is a letdown.Single player is enjoyable. Fun missions active world. It's nice that your actions in the world have an effect on things like the in game stock market. That said you have to rely far too heavily on the stock market if you want to make money as the purchaseable properties offer very little income (often taking hundreds of in game weeks to break even). The amount of money you get is also not well distributed throughout the missions. You get a trickle here and a trickle there then complete the final heist and get more money than you really need only to find you don't really care because you've done all the missionsOnline was a letdown. The heists and jobs are fun and varied but the world is generally populated with people who only wish to blow you up with the rocket powered bike or armored van that they spent $20 to get. That wouldn't be too bad except the load times for basically everything are insane. Something like 7 minutes to join an online server 3 minutes to load into a lobby for a job or a heist 1 2 minutes to load the job or heist... You have to spend 15 minutes just loading to get to a point where you can do the thing you want to do. Couple that with the not infrequent lockups after jobs (which force you to alt+f4 and spend another 10 minutes loading the game) and unnecessarily long transitions between in game rounds and in lobby jobs and you're left with a sour taste.All in all I'd recommend it but for a AAA title from a wildly successful developer I expect better functionality from many of its core elements.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Firstly the game is brilliant aboslutely love it well worth the price loads of content people say the prices can get stupid which they can but all it does is add time to get said content i paid 40 when i first got it never bought a shark card and from my hours i have well worth it made that 40 back in game time and then some. I have pretty much everything and am level 350 this game is not about getting everything it is about the things you want you will never get everything until you are a stupidly high level. I think its sad people won't get the game off the basis they won't get everything in the game. Now to the good stuff.Pros Stupidly High replayability (Singleplayer and online) Looks decent considering how old the game is Loads of content (Singleplayer and online) Really good singleplayer story Brilliant game to meet new people i have met loads of other gamers i now play GTA with and other games Easy to make your money back gameplay wiseCons Modders and hackers are still running around the place not as many but still there Does take time to get stuff Crashes without warning no matter what you are doingOverall i cannot see why i would say you get banned for no reason because i have had plenty of time to get suspended banned etc and have never been never had an issue never had cars business etc disappear so i cannot say that is a disadvantage however it is best to look at other reviews. In my eyes the game is well worth it really fun and great place to meet new people.

review: Alright it's time to change tunes if only because it's taken me this long to see I'm still recommending this. GTA is a game with heart but a heart clogged by the ever increasing pull of Online. The singleplayer remains a hallmark of storytelling and were this game only that I would still recommend it. However GTA has become in full form Online and it is in Online that it has died. Due to P2P networking the game is easily rescripted by any aspiring modder making it a hotbed of money drops player cages and random explosions all brought by people with menus looking for a power trip. These skids are not wholly to blame for their downward spiral however as the moneymaking system in GTA has continued to slide further into uselessness due to shoddy payouts and enemy player incentives it becomes almost necessary these days to acquire a mod menu simply to skip the pointless grind and stop other menu users. To top off this torm R* has enacted a zero appeal ban policy based entirely on computerized selection resulting in ineffective banwaves that largely miss actual cheaters but strip cash and even character data from legitimate users. I enjoy this game immensely in the slim moments where I'm socializing with decent people and having fun driving flying or any of the activities left over from when GTA was made to be fun nowadays these moments are dying and the game is suffering for it.

review: Grand Theft Auto V http //store.steampowered.com/app/271590/ Klick to view the Shop Page Lets Talk about GTA V Category Points (max.10) Graphics 10/10 Sound 10/10 Singleplayer 9/10 Multiplayer 10/10 Long term Motivation 8/10 A few words about each Category First I do personally think that these categorys are the most important ones.Please watch the system Requirements first and make sure that you are able to enjoy the Game in at least tolerable settings. The Graphics at highest/ultra settings are really beautiful and its pretty cool to watch the sunrise lightnings or the nature. Yeah and the cars for sure. The Sound is well done all the different cars and horns and the urban feeling really cool ! Im honest im not a fan of the Singleplayer probabley im just the Multiplayer/Coop guy but im fair and the Singleplayer was definitely hard work and at least better than many other Singleplayer i played so far! Multiplayer in my opinion the best part of GTA V fascinated me really! It's important that you dont play alone thats boring and the long term motivation is not given but if you have some friends or just a community/crew playing the heists/missions with you its amazing. I bet you gonna have so much fun! All the opportunities insane! Yeah the long term Motivation is connected with playing the Multiplayer after the Singleplayer and the Requirements for having fun with the Multiplayer alre listed above ) UPDATE Nov. 2016 Rockstar is still realeasing huge Updates for GTA V and has effectively built one of the biggest communitys on Steam UPDATE Nov. 2018 Regarding the fact that my first review was from august 2015 its truly impressive how many thousand still play the game. New game modes new content the biggest money machine Rockstar games ever mad. Good game.At least &gt THIS GAME IS DEFINITELY WORTH TO BUY (I mean it even dropped in price)&lt

review: Was skeptical about buying at first due to the reviews on many that got banned but it wont happen so long as you avoid hackers or modding the base game. Although that might take out some fun aspects of the game the online mode is already worth it since there are so many things to do (from heists to play mini games like adversery modes or simply participating in a race). It definitely is a grind for money but if you have a bunch of friends to play heists with and wait for sales to buy ur ceo and bunkers you should be raking in millions in no time. Would strongly recommend to anyone that likes open world games and doesnt mind grinding for stuffEdit been playing this game for more than a 100 hrs and i still find stuff to do keep things fun. Grinding money is also easier if u make use of the x2 bonuses and build up ur businesses first.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: From what I've experienced I'd say my experience is pretty mixed. Some of the positive of the game is the story mode which is already good by default the rest of the good things depend on how you play. The mod menu players are very high there is at least a 75% chance to run into a modder if in a free aim lobby. Tryhards are around too but the really annoying ones tend to stay in the free aim lobby. I'd recommend staying in the aim assist lobby even if you dont have a controller. This way you can reduce encounters with the more annoying types of players. Besides all the tryhards and modders I must say that the community is pretty nice compared to the console community. People are pretty helpful when it comes to making money cuz most people realize how tedious it could be when doing it alone. Another thing about this game is making money. The money in this game is way too grindy and most of the items are very expensive. If im honest if you play this game legit it'll take a while before you can have a steady income for the things in the game. You can also see a reason why people in the pc community use mods to get money since its too much work. I was only able to make good money when doing doomsday exploits that gave me 1 mil every 15 minutes without it i probably would not have much via properties or vehicles.Overall I think the only way to have fun with this game is if your not fully invested into making money and more into just messing around. Of course you might need some money to have fun but don't be too materialistic or the experience overall will be pretty negative
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Got this game 2 years ago to play with my friends and honestly it's been soooo much fun. With R* continuing to release new content for Online I even nominated it for the "Labor of Love" award C Note GTA Online is really fun if you already have friends who play it. Getting money is quite difficult especially if you're playing alone. Along with the difficulties of making cash comes modders. These players tend to ruin the experience for everyone in their lobby with blowing up cargo missions players &amp money dropping. (Money dropping isn't as good as it sounds. If you collect to much money from modders you risk the chance of getting your account reset by R* so it's best not to accept any at all.) R* has currently stepped up it's game when it comes to modders. Taking even legal actions against mod menu developers so hopefully with time modders will be something of the past. Overall GTAV is an amazing game and I definitely reccomend it to anyone who wants a game to play with friends. You can hangout in freeroam race around Los Santos in the many cars R* has released since launch make some cash through the R* created heists &amp missions and building your criminal empire as a CEO or the leader of a Motorcycle club just remember this game is REALLY grindy due to in game purchases for vehicles businesses clothing weapons &amp properties are steep in price. Thankfully R* has been doing more free money events like this week's $1 350 000 just by signing on daily &amp discounts on in game purchases. (Note This week's bonus is 1.35 mil all together xd)

review: If you buy this only do it for Single Player as online a complete sh*tshow of hackers and a "support" system that works about as well as life raft in the desert. Single player is awsome and even the player made FiveM can be fun but unless you enjoy tedious grinds to level with the average mission payout of 5 15k (30k on double rp gimmicks) avoid.Why? The average car you'll buy will cost 1 2 million BEFORE upgrades and if you want anything with guns on it 1 6mil. Don't bother with anything nice either you'll just get shot up by someone in a fully armored karuma or sticky bombed or have your apartment camped. Got a plane? Cool there's at least ten different anti air weapon systems that are FAR more nimble than anything you can fly.Remember those hackers? R* calls them modders (lol) and says they'll ban you for it but the hackers can easily unban themselves! Bad sport lobbies are intended for people who repeatedly blow your car up but don't worry they can remove themselves from the BS lobby too! Shame steam doesn't offer a third option of "Sure but only if you're a sociopath" recommendation. Oh and no you can't avoid the modders by simply going to an invite only or crew only lobby as any of the gunrunner biker or business stuff MUST be done in an open lobby. Enjoy?Just adding an addendum for the steal fall sale still say avoid this for anythign but single player.

review: Grand theft auto 5. A masterpiece quietly turned to a horrid money grab. I've spend over forty days on GTA Online on the console version of the game. I've beaten campaign twice and had a really enjoyable experience doing so. GTA Online is the main part of this. From the beginning it was very fun had a ton of friends play it with me doing all sorts of stuff from street races to stealing cars for simion. I've had this game since the release of the game on Xbox 360 around 2013 2014. Played for a long time and it grew a lot. More missions were added more cars. Free DLC. Really above and beyond what i've ever seen for a 60$ game. Later it released heists and other things. Still super fun to play but cars and apartments are becoming more expensive. Ill skip the boring stuff and move on closer to 2017. The game has turned slowly toxic as you can no longer play on xbox 360 and ps3 because of bugs and exploits. People on GTA Online will spawn kill you for no reason and there are more hackers than ever. The new racing game modes is the only thing being released (asides from 5 million dollar cars and jets). It isn't as fun the game is way too complicated now. "Money isn't an issue" is no longer a statement. (sorry jimmy). missions can only give out 20k roughly and heists are boring and a waste of time. (most players dont know how to do it somehow which bugs me) people in lobby's will also troll. But the game can still be enjoyed if you play with friends.Heres a simple list of pros and cons Pros Very detailed and enjoyable campaign Characters have deep and really relatable meanings Multipule endings (very choice relating / open ended story) Many Many things to do off of campaign missions / quests GTA Online can be very enjoyable Open with up to 32 friends! (GTA Online) Tons of things to do in GTA Online Very expansive customization (Online and campaign) Realistic graphics Suits very many playstyles (FPS players Driver players Flying and boating players etc.) User FriendlyCons Very long loading times (sometimes) Campaign has its moments with bugs (mostly fixed though) GTA Online can be and will be toxic Decently demanding game (Need a good PC) Can sometimes be laggy or buggy They want you to buy Microtransactions (GTA Online but not required)Overall I think this is a very good game and I hope they continue the series. Next time please don't ruin the online by making it very relying on microtransactions. also loading times can become a problem. Thank you Rockstar for this game.If there's anything I missed let me know hope you liked the review.(This review was written a long time ago I just posted it recently because I actually bought the game and could submit a review sorry for bad grammar)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

This game is really an amazing expierence that should be on everyones list of pc games to play before you die. Totally recommend it but know what you're getting into before hand.Enjoy the single player learn to play well join some peaceful crew so you can also enjoy the wonderful and entertaining online mode.

review: I did have fun in this game spent more money than I would like to admit i recommend with a big asterisk attached.TL DR Single player is great fun online could be fun in a closed lobby with friends pubs feel yucky like you got dropped in the middle of big cage with a bunch of monkeys slinging their own poop at each other.PROS This game has the most content out of any game i've played. Beautiful vistas and environments. Everything is thought through every company name or store or brand of soda is a pun or a joke if you don't think something isn't a pun then you just don't get the pun. Cars are a great fun to drive incredible amount of planes to fly bikes to ride and places to go. Always different activities and events online so you never have to grind. Arguably you kinda have to but more on this later.Single player is a solid game everyone should do this first before going online. Or NEVER go online because unfortunately that can ruin it for you.CONS Online game is ruined by modders/cheaters/hackers who glitch almost every lobby. The devs are money hungry for microtransactions so everything is insanely priced you make 5 10k per mission a cool car costs 6.5 mil you do the math how long you have to play to buy one car. Same thing with businesses but they have a constant upkeep on top of the millions of dollars you spend for set up and when you try to sell a product from that business to make a profit some hacker just blows you up from nowhere. So now you don't have money or product that you spent several hours grinding its gone in a second. Every lobby has a modder i feel thats how they arrive. And you can't report the hacker because you have no idea who does it. Businesses in general are a huge grindfest that gets old fast and the rewards are miniscule.Load times for everything take a while. Not as bad as it used to be but still. TL DR Single player is great fun online could be fun in a closed lobby with friends pubs feel yucky like you got dropped in the middle of big cage with a bunch of monkeys slinging their own poop at each other.

review: Pros Constant free updates. Content of each update is DLC sized. Shark cards optional grind or simply login to collect weekly bonuses and sales. Developers are clearly passionate about the game. The cars weapons and outfit variety is outstanding. As above the devs are so devoted that they put in a graphics overhaul a while ago. For an aging game it looks brilliant. Lag compensation means that I can play fairly well with friends across the world.Cons When I start up the game it logs me into Saints Row or something. Wait there's a single player mode?

review: The best open world game set in our time. Whether it is better or worse than Skyrim is debatable. In Skyrim you can enter the world's buildings. Not in GTA 5. But the world in GTA 5 feels bigger its city like an actual city in size. In Skyrim the 'cities' are like small villages. Its 'towns' are tiny communities. You get more interaction with most NDP's in Skyrim though. Yet GTA 5 is much more populated. Skyrim has a large very active mod scene. Skyrim also offers a lot more content. GTA 5 offers an offline mode (with plenty more to do there.) Modern city vs. medieval setting.For me GTA 5 is more fun.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I approach women and they insult me and run away just like in real life!Hillarity from the singleplayer campaign aside let me review the online with pros and cons.Cons In game microtransactions in a 60 dollar game100 dollars gives you 1 I repeat ONE vehicle!Rockstar made things like car upgrades and ammo more expensive to make you more likely to spend money on the game.Rockstar made it so you randomly lose your ammo throughout activities wether you die or not so you will have to buy more of it have less money and be more likely to spend money on the game.This is a load screen simulator.If you wanna join a heist the game will make you unload THEN check if there is actually room for you and if there isn't THEN you will have to LOAD back into the session you were already in. Why do we have to load twice? Why do we have to load before the game even checks if there is room for us???Rockstar hates fun and removed your ability to replay missions so now you have to go through THREE loadscreens if you wanna play the same mission again instead of just 1.Rockstar desperately wants people to spend on their price gouging microtransgenders and will therefore make the game worse. They have the option to maybe balance things to make them less profitable but keep them fun but this is Rockstar and they have chosen to fall.Griefers ahoy.The game always displays everyone on the map.You can be killed in passive mode.Forced PVPMany activities simply don't pay enough sometimes not even enough to cover the ammo cost of doing them!Many of the more expensive things in the game are either useless on their own or completely outclassed by cheaper ones.Some missions that shouldn't encourage players to kill you actually do encourage and reward them for doing so.Many missions' ending zones and objectives are known to griefers and they will camp there for hours to at least annoy or stop players from being able to do their missions many players do this even for missions that do not reward griefing.We can't allow mission/heist members into our vehicles? wtf is this? We can either lock our cars to everyone friends friends &amp crew or no one but not lock it to the people we are actually on a mission/heist with.The game can just never sync with the cloud. My game has been trying for 10 days now and hasn't succeeded once.The servers are unstable and may disconnect you at any timeThe game has big issues with alt+tabbing or pressing the windows key leading to major lag which leads to your game unloading you from your current heist/mission/session/online. I found that my issues disappeared if I stopped running wallpapaer engine but others are not so lucky.If the game freezes up for just a little bit it will disconnect you just to with you.If the game loses connection for even a short time it will disconnect you instead of trying to reconnect you like other games.When you receive a message on the social club there is no easy way to check it! You open social club and there's nothing there. You go to social and there's nothing there. You go to message the exact guy who just sent you messages and there's nothing there! Instead you have to go to social club open the option wheel??? and then you will find your messages hidden there. Why the hell was this done?Missions from NPCs reward you less money the quicker you do them. This makes no sense. You'd think they'd pay you more for express delivery but nope! Instead the slower you are at a mission the more it pays you per mission but somehow you at the same time get paid less per minute. This system is just screwed in the head and doesn't make sense. Then again R* wanted to make the game more appealing to the masses and that means making missions easier and paying more for doing less.There are no significant punishments for bad players within the game.The game is almost a griefer's paradise making legit play online worse than it needs to be.Cheaters ahoy!Tanks can blow themselves up because sometimes the projectile collides with the barrel of the tank. This is unacceptable from a AAA developer.Buildings do not render properly when in vehicles. This is especially apparent when idling in a chopper on a rooftop as things chaotically render in and out on their own.Lowering the suspension makes wheels clip through cars.Griefers can join your session blow up or not blow up your stuff abuse the vote kick system make your mission fail by abusing said system and then the game itself gives you negative rep for this ontop of you already failing a mission by getting kicked and losing your hard earned resources by griefing. Rockstar reminded me today of how they are at making games. In a 2v2 game that turns into a 1v2 during the loading screen you will have 1 life vs a team that has 2 lives by default. This makes no ing sense.Rockstar is garbage.Pros Good graphics.Nice cars.Cool helicopters.Cool planes.Voice acting!Gradual progression.Mission variety like assassinations racing stunt racing transform racing theft espionage and a few others.You can own a business.You can have NPCs working under you that will take your bought or stolen goods and produce wealth for you to enjoy.Clubs!Illicit drugsSexViolenceStrippers!But most importantly GUNS!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There is never a moment in which you can say that you have nothing to do on Grand Theft Auto V. Rockstar is constantly launching new free DLCs and the possibilities of customization on GTA online are endless be it on your character or your vehicle or whatever else. This earned this game a nomination for the "Game within a Game" Steam award from me but that's just me.EDIT Hell I don't even play this game with mods but the fact that Take Two (and Rockstar itself) have essentially abolished modding within the game taking away from the game's experience for many players makes it enough for me to change my review of this game. Screw you Rockstar.EDIT2 I've spotted 3 hackers in about 5 days of playing Online recently. One the hacks forced me to restart the game as someone stuck an effin guitar in my character's back and I couldn't for the life of me remove it. Rockstar doesn't seem keen on fixing the rampant hacking that goes on in this game so my negative review remains.

review: This game has alot of pro's and con's. It's up to you if they are deal breakers or not.Pro's Awesome for casual mindless fun. Great with friends I would strongly suggest playing online with friends. Strong singleplayer with a great story and interesting characters. A MASSIVE amount of content to explore (although a majority is online exclusive and costs alot meaning a lot of grinding or microtransactions). But the content is there and it is fun to play.Cons Price (Although it is a full game it still takes money from your wallet and that IMO is a con) Community. It is possible and likely you will meet nice people on here. But online has a lot of people who kill everybody they see. This isnt an issue on singleplayer however (obviously). Price of content in online. There is substantial amount of content in this game. But your ability to access it depends on the time or money you are willing to commit and either way it's alot.These are my main Pro's and Con's I have experienced with this game. At this time i would recommend getting it if you enjoy casual games that you can muck around in. But if you cannot stand grinding and don't wish to pay for content in online then avoid this game. I personally have had many great times in GTA V both singleplayer and online and believe it is worth getting but definately keep an eye out for a sale!

review: The story mode is amazing and well worth the game. However beyond that in Online and a lack of story mode DLC makes this game horrid. The online mode is structured in a Pay to Win format. Players can either purchase shark cards or a mod menu to gain access to stronger/over powered equipment/vehicles instead of playing the game and putting in hours for the rewards. Rockstar will patch and fix any money glitches or clothing glitches but won t fix game breaking hackers. In a game that gives players the option to spend REAL money on in game items but doesn t have an active anti cheat or hacker/mod detection software it gives players an unnecessary risk to run because some mods have the ability to take money from players. If I purchased a $100 shark card only to join a lobby with a modder who proceeds to take said GTA$8 000 000 from me they d be stealing that $100 straight from my wallet. Yet Rockstar is happy to continue making sales on their microtransactions while rarely listening to community feedback sending dodgy support ticket responses and extreme lack of anti cheat in online play. It s an amazing game with great detail and endless hours of fun but the all little things show the true intentions of its developers Money first only expensive online content second community when we get to it. Let s hope GTA 6 will show a different side.

review: Shame. If there's one word to describe GTA V that is the word.Sadly it is. It has many many tons of contents and what i mean tons is literally TONS you can do heists small jobs run your own companies motorcycle club clubhouse etc. You car guys may even fall in love with this game and spent lots of time creating your own dream garage in this virtual game. Do you ever want to be a boss with your own bodyguards and skycrapers and multi level garage? This game got it for you. Do you want a high tech facility for your own biddings? This game got it for you. Do you just want to enjoy a beautiful scenery with your friends? This game got it for you.But sadly most of them are behind a big paywall. And yes i am familiar with grinding so i am quite okay with it. But this game has the level of grinding which for most people is unbearable. Thus forcing you to buy the so called "Shark Cards" or in other word microtransaction. Yes a pay to play game with freetoplay elements. Which is a recipe for disaster. Even it's a grind but with all these heists and other stuff it must be atleast enjoyable right? ....No. A big gigantic NO. You will spent maybe half of your playtime staring at loading screens. And if that wasn't bad enough connections are kind of garbage in this current state which is Peer to Peer. AND if these wasn't bad enough there are lots of hackers griefers and just overall bad people. Just like almost every popular games out there GTA V has a very bad community.It's a great game. It is. But the executions are just...horrible. I can't stress you enough that it's such a shame on how this game became to be as it is right now.In my opinion full price is an absolute No absolutely No No NO. Buy it atleast while it's on discount you can play singleplayer and mod the hell out of it when the story's finished. But stay out of online if you don't have other friends playing this game. It can be tons of fun with your friends even with the cons i've said above. But if you insist to play online on your own just expect a huge amount of frustration.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

So much time and effort put into the tool so that people could make the game their own and it's all gone due to the greed of Rockstar and TakeTwo.

review: Okay so till date this title (Grand Theft Auto V) has sold over 100 000 000 copies worldwide 5 years 3 months after Rockstar Games took gamers back to the streets of Los Santos this game continues to break records. With "Grand Theft Auto V" already becoming the most profitable entertainment product of all time Rockstar is in no rush to bring out a new title. This means that the gap between Grand Theft Auto V and VI will be the longest among the franchise. Rockstar's parent company Take Two announced its financials for 2019 and revealed that Grand Theft Auto V has "outperformed" expectations. Lastly I would like to say that Grand Theft Auto Online is never a boring game. I never know quite what the next five minutes will bring and in any given moment I might be thrilled or frustrated or both but I'm always engaged The DLC updates have kept the Online game interesting as they come out every Quarter and the Heists are always fun to do with friends.It's a BIG "YES" if you want to buy this game anytime soon its worth every penny!
