review: I dont want to write a review on the online. So i will give a brief on the online mode. it is essentially endless and still being updated. The fun is in the grind if u do not enjoy the grind you will not have fun. Now then back to Singleplayer. The game tells the story of somone who has made alot of mistakes in his time try and make some rights. After being inspired by the son he never had and some help of secreat govrnment officials working on the down low the story shifts over to where his own past comes to quite literrally haunt him. He then solves the issue the onyl way he knows with crime. Its a good story not perfect not a normal story either. Its good. The gameplay is extremely fun and the world is similar to skyrim where it is just one big engine in the form of a virutal playground. Once you install mods you literally make the game what you want. I can recomend the game alone based on the mods there are for the game. There quite well made aswell. Want a zombie apocolypse while surving ina snowy city. theres a free mod for that. Want there to be a world disaster like a tornado raveging through the map destoying everything easy peasy. maybe a tidal wave ingulfing the entire city as you try and survive on a roof of a skyrscrapper. the game is quite liuterally what you make it.

review: The innocent days of coming home after school on a Friday afternoon a 2 30 and getting on Grand Theft Auto with all your online friends for a weekend of rampage madness money making spending sprees and stripclubs. The game was a lot of fun back in 2013 2015 when there was still so much to do both in single player and online but once you experience it all play through the story mode and spend hundreds on hundreds of hours on the game it will eventually get boring and you won't have that much left to do. I would highly recommend this game to anybody who has never played it before but it is not really worth the purchase if you have done everything. One cool thing about it though is being able to download mods like LSPDFR or go on the external mod FiveM and play on roleplay servers. Alone on the GTA V mod FiveM have accumulated about 1.7k+ hours just on playtime on my gaming computer plus the other 4 5k+ hours on PlayStation 3&amp 4.

review: Well what else can I say about this game except "this game is exce llent!" About the story mode well the story is interesting and exciting and you can do a bunch of things in Los Santos. And then about the GTAOL it's really easy to be addicted to it. I played for over 600 hours in the online mode busy earning money. To be honest in OL you will first suffer a long time being a new guy in Los Santos. Your rank is low you can't buy those powerful weapons yet and you are always kicked when joining a heist by those high rank players. It's quite surprising that I don't have much suffering memory about my noob experience. Also it's quite an arduous job to earn money. As a nice little player I was always doing a heist stealling cars as a CEO resupplying for the bunker and drug farms importing cargos and so on. And because every coin doesn't come easy I carefully manage my money only to buy those really necessary cars (and only when on sale). But still until hundreds of time spent on it did my manage to buy all the basic stuffs. Of course you can just be a modder and earn billions of dollars in just on click but I think in this case you'll soon find the game meaningless and boring once you easily buy every car and house and plane. Oh and speaking about modders and hackers I don't blame them for using the tools to get money since they don't bother anyone but sometimes they get really annoying. Some modders will suddenly teleport to your and give you a big friendly gift and blow you up or glitch some textures on you and make you have to quit the game or spawn fire right under your a.s.s or kick you out of your cars or planes or blablablablablabla. But at least these are still bearable. SOME of the modders will even get yourself BANNED! They can spawn millions of cash in front of you and wait till you take the bait they can kill every player and make the system says that you have killed all these players...... Well if you ever see a modder just quit as fast as you can. You'll never know their capacities. And when you do it's already too late. Oh and there is another important thing you need to know if you want to begin your GTAOL life. R* is REALLY REALLY REALLY bad at distinguishing normal players and modders/hackers especially when R* decides to suddenly check thr server really hard randomly in a year. During that special period you'd better not go online. Because if one modder is banned during that time there must be many normal players get fcked as well. R* will delete your characters alone with all your effort and time spent on it. Well last time when R* started the big catastrophe I just lucked out playing Dying Light and avoided the risk. Anyway GTA is a good game although it may have some problems the really glowing points won't be blocked. It's worth playing.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V was the best Open World game if not the best game in recent times thanks to its unique take on the real world and the superficial and active city of LA while seemlessly integrating some goofyness and wackyness that still kept great immersion. Whether it be a tense shoot out with police or a executing that perfectly planned heist or even just the mundane like driving and exploring the city the game strayed away from reality however it was never a ridiculous as future content for the online portion of the game.Throughout the last year or so the addition of flying vehichles car submarines and pay to kill laser beams have stripped away the initial charm and captivation the game once had the latest update however almost completey takes away what made the game what it is. The latest update features a car arena game mode which is accompanied but a new way to customize cars. The car are take on an almost 'Mad Max' aesthetic which seems out of place and out of character for GTA V and its setting however my major gripe with this update are what these new cars can do. Lauching cars in traffic by tapping npcs with your car and guns that shoot laser beams just doesn't make me as a player feel like im a criminal on my way to success the original path the player was put on at the start of GTA Online.GTA V was once the gold standard of a new open world game.Now its a glorified Saints Row.

review: This game is such a mixed bag. Im going to start with the negatives. Also i only play online. The city is usually a war zone which can be fun unless modders are on your server. This game has a serious cheating problem but Rockstar doesn t seem to care. They speak freely in chat about what they do &amp offer money drops to people. Stay away from modded money because you can get banned. Rockstar needs to protect their micro transactions. People say if you spend it right away you wont get banned but I wont take the risk. Microtransactions ruin the game. People who spend lots of real money on shark cards (or modders) have an unfair advantage over everyone else. They can buy over powered vehicles like flying cars with lock on missiles that would take a normal person forever to make enough money for. These OP vehicles all go for over 1 million in game dollars. Plus you need a special garage to store them which is another 1 mill or more. The average in world job pays 5k 10k. Yes you can make more money doing Heists &amp dispatch missions but i have a hell of a time with the matchmaking for that. When i do get into a heist someone will die over &amp over or just leave giving you no money regardless of how much time you spent in the mission. Once after the few heists i managed to complete my former teammate killed me &amp took my cut. Depot any money you have in the bank ASAP because deposited money cant be stolen. Dont bother buying a motor cycle club because if you die during a MC mission the game glitches &amp thinks the "contract" is still active. Even days later i cant accept a new contract. Total waste of money. Now for some positives. This game can be a lot of fun under "normal" conditions which is why im giving a positive review. The game does give you one free sports car which you have to claim from you phone but you need to own a garage first to store it. Your best bet is to find some friends to team up with. None of my IRL friends play anymore presumably because they are tired of the modders. That said I've met some cool people in game that i team up with to do jobs. Higher lever players can hire you to to guard them or do runs with. You get a lot of XP from hanging out with a President or CEO. Just make sure they give you a good pay rate or it wont be worth you time. This is the work i do the most. Even still i can only manage to make 100k in an hour which sounds like a lot but isnt. While you can buy a property for 50k they suck. All the good properties or 1 million or more. Speaking of properties you are limited to the cars you can store. You are only allowed to keep cars that are valued at under 100k in the ingame store. The only reason i can think of is to promote microtransactions. I can understand not being able to steal another players vehicle but you should be able to keep any random car you find. Inconclusion i am mostly happy with this game for the $15 i paid on steam. If you can accept the faults that i laid out you'll probably like it also! I forgot to mention that if you are being killed over &amp over by a player you can change the server you are on. If you need someone to team up with feel free to message me.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I want to recommend this game but R*'s business model absolutely ruins it. Pros &gt Arguably one of the best single player games ever&gt vehicles are fun to drive and varied&gt single player story has hundreds of hours of game play if you don't speed run&gt R* stepped down from the forge ban for single playerCons &gt character movement is still pretty bad but tolerable on controller.&gt Multiplayer is an unregulated show because R* only bans people who cheat money not the people making the game toxic because toxicity doesn't cut into their $$$$$$&gt all updates are multiplayer exclusive all the fancy/fun is locked down to multiplayer. Single player hasn't been touched since launch.My advice buy it for the single player when it's on sale and don't even touch the multiplayer unless you have enough friends to fill a lobby (5 15 people).

review: Still one of the best games ever made. Single player has an incredible narrative great characters and top notch voice acting for everyone line of dialogue (and theres a lot.) Incredible open world Los Santos still feels like a real city and its level of immersion still holds up years later not many games can say that. Owned this on console when it launched but bought it here for GTAO (mistake.)GTA Online is a different matter. Its a cool multiplayer sandbox where you can build an empire buy cars and houses and start businesses. But the grind is real. I read reviews talking about it but didnt appreciate just how intense the grind is. After playing GTAO for a few hours I had finally earned enough money to buy... a shirt? Seriously? Clothing is like 5 10k weapons are 15k+ and I dont even want to think about how expensive the cars and houses are. I can appreciate somewhat a grind that elongates progression so the game lasts you awhile. But at such an egregious and painful rate it makes playing the game feel defeating and futile.After playing Red Dead Redemption Onlines beta I was looking for a similar sandbox style online game. RDR2's online beta has only 6 missions and is really light on content but even that was better by comparison. They are similar in mission structure you start a mission and watch a short cutscene for some light story exposition on the job then set off. But the missions themselves feel like pointless filler. One had me go to location A to acquire item 1 (drugs) then go to location B. Another had me go to a gas station point my gun at the clerk to rob it then leave and mission complete. Really thats it? Ill assume the missions get better but Im not sure if itll hold my interest long enough for me to see that.So far Ive gotten those 2 missions and nothing else. Im assuming there is more but nothing new comes up. No jobs no emails no texts. Maybe its a glitch either way it leaves me in an open world with nothing to do save the generic deathmatch/race/etc multiplayer matches against people who are hundreds of levels above me and multi millionaires.Some "side" activities in GTAO are poorly executed. Bounties where you go find a wanted person are frustrating. They have you go to a huge circle location that the target is in but dont give any details on where to find them. I searched in the zone for about 20min went through every nook and cranny multiple times after I couldnt find the guy I just gave up. Not sure if it was a bug or if the missions are just crappy by design.Another was a treasure hunt that shows you a tiny little picture in your phone and a giant circle area to search in. Needless to say it was completely boring and a total slog combing through a vast area looking for a landmark I could barely make out from the pic. Again after about 15min of searching I gave up.There are griefers in the online mode but I havent run into hackers. Some dude decided he wanted to gank me multiple times for no apparent reason. I have a low tolerance to trolling and griefing so I had to quit the session and join a new one. Compounding this issue is that bored billionaire players with jets attack choppers and maxed out stats and gear can wipe the floor with you and there wont be a thing you can do.There is a "passive mode" to alleviate frustration from griefers but its borderline useless. Other players cant shoot you but you cant shoot ANYONE even NPC's I couldnt do the missions because it was enabled the mechanic is poorly designed. The option is buried deep in the options menu and is a hassle to activate/deactivate making it feel even more useless.There is are microtransactions to alleviate the grind which many people take issue with. I appreciate the option however and its nice to know if I stick around in GTAO I can speedup the grind process.Overall 9/10 For $30 the SP is worth it. For MP I wouldnt recommend at that price.

review: Honestly dont even know where to start.. Ill try to keep this nice and simple. Cops Spawning way too frequently when i gain 1 star theres atleast 3 4 cops spawning 5 meters infont behind and in all angles possible to shoot me down with their overpowered aim. Well the CEO version of this costs 12000 and gives you 2 minutes. Because rockstarBack to money (actually this is more of a police rant) now paying 60 (now 25 ) to basically spend 90% of the time avoiding the police who by the way spawn everywhere when trying to escape its just one of those things that makes you wonder whats the point of even playing this game. You walk on the sidewalk you get a star youre dead. Have fun with some cool space alien tech get a star get killed pvp with your friend get a star get run over by a tank get a star because you attempted to defend yourself before that tank get killed.... Also sometimes just driving pass the police station will get you a few stars immediately because why not?Basically everytime i try to have fun and actually enjoy this overpriced game i get shot down by the police for literally anything.Spent millions on just calling the cops off while pvping because they seem to have a better aim and deal more damage than the tryhards youre fighting.Oh also theres this great deal on a car you can buy for 2 million dollars but before you do that you need to buy an arena for like 2 million dollars so then you can upgrade your car so you can customize it as you wish but wait one bumper is worth 500.000$.Have fun.

review: YOU BETTER HAVE THIS GAME EVEN THO IT'S ALREADY 2019.The story is spectacular. Once you finish the story the game will not be boring because the game is not a dead end there's random events in singleplayer that you can take on. You can also apply mods in the game if you want to.The GTA Online is very amusing. You can freely roam in the game with various activities in game. You can never be bored since it has also various businesses which you need to maintain after buying one. The GTA Online is also updated I also love their Winter Theme in game. There are various of players that also makes the game interesting since you don't know what they will do. They can interrupt in your business missions steal supplies etc. You can also team up with your friends while doing the heists which makes fun. The new dlc (Arena War) is a good one. Once you purchase an arena war workshop you can customize almost all cars in the workshop. You can change the colors of the lights and it also provides a FREE wheel types of Chrome.If you want peace then you can also activate Passive mode which players can't kill you. However you can't use your guns cars with minigun/rockets or other deadly objects. SO WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? GET THE GAME NOW IF YOU DON'T HAVE IT.GRINDING MONEY IS NOT THAT BAD AFTERALL.

review: Overall very fun but online is a letdown.Single player is enjoyable. Fun missions active world. It's nice that your actions in the world have an effect on things like the in game stock market. That said you have to rely far too heavily on the stock market if you want to make money as the purchaseable properties offer very little income (often taking hundreds of in game weeks to break even). The amount of money you get is also not well distributed throughout the missions. You get a trickle here and a trickle there then complete the final heist and get more money than you really need only to find you don't really care because you've done all the missionsOnline was a letdown. The heists and jobs are fun and varied but the world is generally populated with people who only wish to blow you up with the rocket powered bike or armored van that they spent $20 to get. That wouldn't be too bad except the load times for basically everything are insane. Something like 7 minutes to join an online server 3 minutes to load into a lobby for a job or a heist 1 2 minutes to load the job or heist... You have to spend 15 minutes just loading to get to a point where you can do the thing you want to do. Couple that with the not infrequent lockups after jobs (which force you to alt+f4 and spend another 10 minutes loading the game) and unnecessarily long transitions between in game rounds and in lobby jobs and you're left with a sour taste.All in all I'd recommend it but for a AAA title from a wildly successful developer I expect better functionality from many of its core elements.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Is this game good? Yes.Do I recommend it? No. This is my most played game of all time. On PS3 and PS4 I racked up thousands of hours in GTA Online. But Rockstar's (actually it's mostly Take Two's fault) actions against the modding community have ruined this game entirely on PC. With the most recent update Rockstar has made it extremely difficult to mod online cars into single player at all. These anti online content measures were implemented years ago but the most recent update makes almost any attempt to get around their anti spawn crash the game completely.Rockstar also effectively shut down Menyoo the most popular and useful mod menu for GTA V single player. They do this to get more people online to buy in game currency and make preemptive purchases. Thing is I'd be more happy to play the online if I could play with the things in single player first.The game itself is amazing. I miss the days when I could play it without being badgered for my credit card number.I'm sad now. Greed has ruined a beautiful game and franchise.FINAL SCORE SINGLE PLAYER 9/10FINAL SCORE ONLINE STABILITY 6/10FINAL SCORE ONLINE GRINDING 3/10FINAL SCORE ONLINE GAMEPLAY WITH FRIENDS 8/10FINAL SCORE ONLINE GAMEPLAY WITH RANDOMS /10FINAL SCORE REGARDING DEVELOPER /10IN A NUTSHELL ROCKSTAR HAS RUINED THEIR OWN MASTERPIECE. PRESS F TO PAY RESPECTS AND GET BANNED INSTANTLY.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is a very fun game with as many hours of gameplay as you desire. Saying I recommend this game because of all the fun opportunity's to be had. First of all the single player is very fun and makes you get to know the characters. By the end you will be very satisfied with the story. Making decisions to decide what happens in the end. But online is where it can get interesting. Unless you have multiple friends you will have a lot of struggles getting the things that you want. It will take countless hours to get anything. When first starting you will be making 100k an hour if you are lucky. So you assume it will take 30 hours just to get 3 million. Which a lot of things are this price if not more. In this game you will also need money to make more money. So the start will be very hard to rank up and get on your feet. When I bought this it was on sale for $15 and a bundle for $20 for both the game and the starter pack. The starter pack includes 10 million dollars worth of stuff which I would recommend buying it if it is only 5 dollars more. It will save you a lot of time grinding to start making lots. But there are still a lot of problems with the game including loading screens that don't load. Also you about find a hacker in every game. Trolling or just in god mode which is very frustrating. If you are not one that will buckle down to this game and put tons of hours in the game I don't know if I'd recommend the game for the online. But if you are willing to put up with the countless hours of grinding doing the same thing over and over just for one item then I would recommend. But if your one that gets frustrated at people I wouldn't recommend it. Hackers will frustrate you and ruin gameplay. But I would recommend this game at the end of the day.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is a welcome installment to the fantastic franchise. Voice acting is top notch story is fantastic and the guns and cars all feel smooth to control and are fun to use. Rockstar has yet again created a living breathing world to explore and be apart of. Now how good is the PC version? GTA IV had a not so great PC port so some of you may not expect much but this port is fantastic. I would say it is the best way to play it with the inclusion of the developer console and mods of course. In my opinion this game is a modern masterpiece and everyone should play it at least once.10/10

review: Hey you! Yeah you! If you like games where hackers run rampant and good behavior is considered having your vehicle destroyed constantly while people flame the chat with racial slurs and the only competant way to get anything done is on a private session with less benefits this game is for you! Do you also enjoy having hackers place cages across your apartment and setting you on fire during missions blocking your movement and killing you? This game is for you! I aactually am having a lot of fun playing the game but there seems to be no regulation for any of these hackers destroying gameplay for legit players. If you do not have friends you can play with or enjoy playing with have fun connecting for 10 minutes to one server only to find hackers and connect to a new server for you guessed it another ten minutes! The game really needs love it isn't getting at the moment or at least needs its problems brought to light and acknowledged better than they are. Thirty dollars is not a good price to be coated in hackers this late in the game.

review: The single player portion of this game is worth the asking price in itself. I cannot praise the production direction acting and overall experience enough!! BUY IT NOW!However the online portion of the game is a love it or hate it experience. There is a huge variety of enjoyable content it is regularly updated too despite RDR2 landing recently. However Rockstar actively promote griefing via certain missions (intercepting other peoples sales) if this is not your thing you may find yourself changing servers often.While I have had some bittersweet experiences with the support usually if you can submit a ticket they will sort your issues out. You are advised to report hackers/modders though and if you accept free money from them you can expect repercussions!!

review: I've purchased this game 3 times on 3 different consoles/pc's. This may be in my top 3 favorite games ever. The game itself is spectacular. It's fun. It looks and plays amazing on the PC. Many times I've been in awe just staring out at the ocean or coming over a mountain during sun rise or set. Standing on a corner watching traffice and people just go about their day. It's all incredibly immersive.Sound is a typical Rockstar experience. Meaning it's spectacular. All the voice acting and the near perfect soundtrack keep me from muting the game and putting on a podcast like i do with most games.GTA online is..... something else. I feel almost like it needs a sperate review. I hate it. It's boring 80% of the time and is complete bs the other 20. You either run around for minutes looking for anything to do or you get sniped the second you spawn. No one wants to like DO anything. It's impossible to pug anything as everyone just kills everyone on sight. Also pressed to mention that the shark cards that are included in this are a constant pull on your wallet."oh whats that? you want to buy this apartment? great! you can run 500 races that may or may not be doable because of lack of populaton. or when you get into them who KNOWS if someone is cheating or not as we don't do anything about them. OOOOR you could spend $15 on this shark card and buy it now" It just feels grimey.

review: OLD REVIEW People are finding out that Take Two sent the cease and desist order to OpenIV which is well known and is BS. What I JUST found out makes me even more mad.The closing of OpenIV subsequently shut down various major modding projects. Some of these projects include mods that were bringing Liberty City and its entirety to Grand Theft Auto V. Not only did Take Two bring unwanted shame upon Rockstar but upon themselves. Take Two also didn't only shut down OpenIV they personally sent letters to the OpenIV team requesting them to stop zerolives.com development of the GTAV Liberty City mod after YEARS of hard work on a mod that they wanted to roll out purely for consumer enjoyment . Here is the link to a petition being spread around here in hopes to save OpenIV www.change.org . Sadly while I do not think this petition will change anything (regardless of the backer count) it still never hurt to try.I'd kill for Red Dead Redemption's New Austin/West Elizabeth map to be ported over to Grand Theft Auto V but sadly it doesn't look like it's going to happen.EDIT The OpenIV fiasco is somewhat over with modding slowly but steadily returning to GTA V but Rockstar still has too much pressure on buying micro transactions. The "free" DLC is totally bogus. It either requires a two weeks worth of heist grinding to buy one crap car or 5 seconds with the the authorization of a shark card purchase.Therefore this review will stay negative.EDIT #2 drove around in a car worth 50 real US dollars and made black people fight each other8/10 hundreds of hours of fun

review: Not worth it it was a great game on old gen (ps3 and xbox360) taking in acc its limitations but the game feels completely driven by the campaign (which isn't different in any aspect to the old gen one) and once you complete it there's nothing to do on single player besides secondary missions that get repetitive really soon.The online mode (which is way more enjoyable) has a lot of different gamemodes activities events and challenges and they are all fun but the players won't join as they are doing a more important activity grinding money. The whole game progression depends on a massive grind and you can't do anything else as nobody will join to any activity. Also the only profitable ways to obtain money can be easily griefed by other players which will probably have better stuff than you for doing so. By the other hand the online mode is really enjoyable and grinding is way easier if you have plenty of friends to play with you (at least 3 active friends). The most profitable ways of grinding depend on other players and most activities require at least 4 players to play so your game experience can become far better.I do NOT recommend buying this game for the full price as it is not worth it but you should consider buying it on sale if you like open world games specially if you have some friends to play with.

review: While this game can very frequently kick you in the face it can also reward you if you can get around the annoyances...There are many aspects of this game that are great Rockstar has managed to make it a sort of all in one kind of game. Freeroam racing flight fighting the basic stuff. There's some fantastic car customization property ownership and weapon modification to personalize yourself beyond the outfit you wear. It's even grown to the point of you managing a one man criminal empire (although bringing as many friends as possible helps a lot) within a couple of disciplines. There's bank robbery drug production and sales weapons R&amp D and more...The problem is that Rockstar unnecessarily forces how you can use the things. First of all you MUST play in a public lobby to resupply your businesses or sell your product to make your money. It's easy if there's not a lot of strangers roaming about but if others are around they're bound to sniff you out and destroy you for no reason besides their K/D ratio and looking badass. There's also logic problems that I personally find that make me feel like "I have the money why can't I just pay more to have this as an added bonus?" or "With everything else I have why can't I just do this or that?" or "If I'm allowed to have / use this here why can't I use it there too?"Generally I can have a good time on this game but it is unbelievably annoying sometimes to the point where I can't accomplish something that sounds quite simple.

Along with this the modding in this game is very nice and just grants the player with an insane amount of freedom beyond the status quo. This game is fantastic and by giving the players full control of their actions in game it creates a dynamic environment that makes this game addicting.

review: It's a free to play game that cost me $60. If you're going to completely ignore the multiplayer then I would definitely recommend the story mode if you can pick this game up for $20 or less. There are a multitude of problems with the online portion of GTA. First off is the loading times every loading screen in this game no matter how good your computer takes an average of over a minute. For a game that requires a loading screen every time you start it and join a mission this is unacceptable. Secondly the game is about 4x as grindy as it should be. Every mission you complete should give you twice the amount that it does and every item you have to buy should cost 50% of what it does with a few outliers here and there. The missions that give you good payouts are mind numbingly boring. When the only reason to play a game is for the rewards at the end that says a lot about how awful the actual gameplay is. There are also some design decisions that make you think about the IQ levels of the developers. For example there is a mission that requires you to go out to sea and collect three crates. However one person can only collect one crate at a time. This is no problem if you have 2 other friends to help you but as a solo player you will have to make the same boring trip 2 more times after your first. And you can't control when you get this mission so everytime it gets randomly selected I let out a deep long sigh. While I'm nitpicking I'll also complain about how the heists are nearly impossible if you aren't in a group of 4 with communication. The mission where you have to sneak into the merryweather base without being seen at all is literally the opposite of fun. And why does the whole mission end when one person leaves? Why can't the mission spot just be filled or done with 3 people? Some missions require 4 people when they could be done solo it's absolutely ridiculous. I'm just upset because this could be one of the most fun games if rockstar and take two weren't so lazy and greedy.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Great game that lives up to the Grand Theft Auto series... However the only downside is the obscene amount of hackers and poor online server options that make this game quite unpolished. Update No attempts by R* to stomp out hackers and botters. In regards to how fun the game is now is very mixed. You can get enjoyment out of the game either 3 ways.1. Long hours of grinding the same content for little cash or RP rewards while everything costs very high. Such as mission completion is based on time spent on it versus just completing it. Me and a few friends determined that spending 16 to 20 minutes on a 6 player mission will only give you roughly 60k cash and 10k RP? while everything in the game will cost you $1 million and up.2. You can opt in to purchase shark cards and pay to win by allowing you to access vehicles and weapons to your arsenal. Great for those that don't mind spending real $$$ for digital goods. Terrible for those that see spending $50 on a shark card just to buy 2 cars or 1 building.3. Some subreddit discord servers do offer money drops but this is where hackers come in and put people in risk of account bans.Although this game is no longer interesting to me or my friends. Especially grinding the 4 player missions over and over again for 100+ hours. We determined that this way of grinding money is not efficient anymore either.If you are a group player you may find this game fun playing with others like any open sand box game to mess around in.If you are a solo player. This game might not be the one for you. RD2 might be another alternative for that.

review: This game is the epitome of a cash grab. At first I really loved this game which can be seen by my 600+ hours in play time but I just can't recommend it anymore. Rockstar clearly doesn't care about anything that doesn't make them money off of microtransactions. Singleplayer doesn't get updated ever with new content and all the multiplayer updates are just new ways to compel their players to buy Shark Cards. While on the topic of updates let me just say that I cannot stand the new ones anymore. They are starting to distance themselves from reality in the name of new content. Heists? Hell Yeah! Biker Bars and Office Buildings? Sure why not. Flying bikes with rockets on them? Uhhh... Doomsday bunkers jet packs and orbital cannons? Alright I'm out. While it is nice to see that Rockstar has spent nearly 5 years updating this game they are clearly running out of content and I hate that this game is being sucked dry in the name of profit...

review: This is my new account and currently in this account had 25 hours of playtime in it. Combined with my old one then probably reach 200+ hours. But you don't care about that at all I know. I play this game on a pc that considered low end these days.SpecificationIntel I5 3570sRam 8GBNvidia 750TiLets get started!This game is playable on my pc with high texture settings and other mixed settings with average 60fps.GAMEPLAY The offline story is great with great characters that make you feel like you are in there become them. Long storyline with different with many main mission for team mission(all three characters) and a few main and side mission for each individual character. There are a lot that you can do in offline but there are more in online. And now is the online platform. It is really great. With a lot of mission stuff you can buy and a lot of activities like stunt races and theres constantly a new event too! Currently is the arena something something.. The are few things that aren't great about it which is There are so many micro transactions online platform need a lot of spending real money to really enjoy it ( which is hard for someone who already struggle just to get the game like me) hacker (getting few everyday. the anti cheat is working not like CSGO) getting few and fewer player everyday.So is it worth to buy?FULL PRICE Yes if you are rich75% Yes if you really want to play it50% Absolutely (RARE SALES)49% and below Its a steal! (Never reach this range of price yet)

review: If you asked me what i thought of this game before I probably would've said the following. "The singleplayer is alright. The multiplayer despite some issues is pretty good!"Let me adjust that. The single player is okay. not much of a change of opinion there. It's an average gta singleplayer with about as much replayability as one of those japanese switch machines that keeps switching itself off everytime you turn it on. Mods enhance the experience like they do with any other game.The multiplayer? where to ing begin. Load times are as unbearable as ever. But where the true monster that is this piece of garbage is the stagnation of the gameplay. Let's start where the ridiculousness began to pick up. Gunrunner's arsenal introduced several new things to the game. It introduced a whole bundle of new vehicles missions and the bunker which could make you money through selling arms stock. I won't go too in depth on this but what you need to know is that this is where things begin to pick up. A bike was introduced in this DLC that you could buy for 3.6 million undiscounted (2.7 discounted). This vehicle was the oppressor a bike capable of taking to the air with a boost from the ground that could glide around after the boost. The most notable thing about this was the missile upgrade. This allows you to shoot homing missiles from the bike while in the air.While OP there were some balances made to make sure this wasn't entirely OP. It could only stay in the air for so long the missiles were limited (negated if you were an MC president) and the missile's tracking wasn't extremely accurate. Despite this people began to notice that the game was starting to up the ante in terms of the ridiculousness of the vehicles.Two updates later and rockstar had done it again. A new sportscar was added to the game called the Deluxo. It's basically a flying delorean. Didn't think the oppressor was strong enough? Well evidently rockstar decided that was the case. This new vehicle knocks off two of what balanced the oppressor right off the bat. First off it can maintain altitude instead of having to glide like the oppressor. this means that if you just position yourself correctly you can just hold onto mouse 2 and never let go. However more importantly This Deluxo had perfect accuracy. missiles can turn on a dime if they need to. Despite all of this You could maybe somehow probably make the argument that "because it's a bigger target and moves slower it needs to compensate with better accuracy!"Okay fine then. Your stockholm syndrome has taken full effect but you know what? I'll happily entertain rockstar one final time for the final DLC of the game. Surely they've learned there lesson haven't they?... ING HAVEN'T THEY?!And so the final DLC came around. And on this unholy release came rockstar's final you to the fanbase that stuck around from the early days of vanilla to the games final days. One final knife in the back that will the game up (because we're going to read dead who gives a .)Enter the oppressor mk 2. So remember how i talked about how there was still a reason for the Deluxo to exist yeah? well Rockstar in their infinite ing wisdom decided to create a vehicle With some of the worst counters.Let me explain. The oppressor mk 2 is a bike sized deluxo without machineguns. it is the size and speed of an oppressor mixed with the missiles of the deluxo that can also use chaff/flares to stop incoming missiles. What this means is that the original counter to the deluxo don't matter for when you're trying to hit a target that is constantly bobbing up and down that is the size of a flea on your screen. The missiles also have perfect accuracy so all they have to do is lock on to you for just a moment and fire at you. Good luck countering them on the ground. Want to try and gun 'em down with a minigun? Again good luck trying to hit a target that is the size of a flea. Homing missiles? Dodged or counter measures stopped them in their tracks. And if you weren't killed by the looney on the flying bike he'll probably just use a hack to crash your game (because when you have an anticheat constructed from quality street wrappers it's surprisingly easy to find cheaters who just set everyone on fire.Sure you could invest real time and buy your own oppressor mk 2 but then you become part of the problem. And there you start to see why this all is. The only good and consistent counters to these bloody things is to grind and grind for hours and hours until you have one vehicle that you can use to barely counter it.Or you could just buy your way there! Spend titloads of cash on shark cards and get there instantly! Rockstar wants you to spend loads of cash just to enjoy the multiplayer.Do i recommend this game? Absolutely ing not.Do you own this game? Do yourself a favour uninstall that and get a better game. If you have below 500 hours you might just be able to get over it. If you really want the game that badly pirate it so Take Two interactive (Rockstar's publisher) can lose out on your custom. this game. Thanks for taking away 1 400 hours of my life.TL DR Singleplayer is okay. Multiplayer sucks huge because of very little balancing and being ecouraged to buy microtransactions all the bloody time. Don't buy. Pirate if you absolutely have to.

review: Polished beautiful funny and just plain fun GTA V rekindled the love I felt for the franchise when I played San Andreas. I found the player characters diverse comical and endearing. Switching between them kept the experience fresh and engaging. This is the first game that really tested my rig though I still managed to stay north of 60 fps with nearly all settings maxed. Graphically GTA V dropped my jaw and gave me several "The future is now!" moments. Even my artist wife would stop to gawk and admire what was on screen. A great balance between mostly linear plot and sandbox rampage I found driving and combat to be smooth with the right amount of challenge. My one game play gripe is the clumsy feeling pedestrian experience where it is all to easy to accidentally jump face first into a wall that I intended to scale. I found the plot to be engrossing through the final scene and can see myself retreading the story in a month or two. I originally was going to wait for the first price drop to purchase but a couple videos of gameplay graphics at 1080p was enough to persuade my wallet to open. I have no regrets. This truly is my favourite video game of all time and certainlly the best game ever in the 21 century.10/10 It's a MASTERPIECE of gaming design!

review: After the hype has moderately died down it's pretty boring in the grand scheme of things. As is such with other GTA games well some would argue that GTA San Andreas still holds its own in the modern day along with GTA IV but that is debatable. Anyway the only real reason you would get and play this game now anyway is maybe GTA Online? I am unsure because of Rockstar essentially is just keeping it on life support for the most part with semi annual content "updates" that albeit are "free" half of them in general are pretty lame and uninspiring and nothing that couldn't have already been achieved a while before with modding. Speaking of mods Rockstar is very ironically subjective against modding which seems like a fair point until you take into account how a large majority of people can and have multiple times modded in cash and weapons and got away with it if they were in the right place at the right time. Which in a way defeats the purpose of any attempt to try to prevent abuse of modding to insert cash vehicles weapons and so forth. Even in singleplayer it has been documented that it is possible to be banned from playing online even if you aren't planning on or haven't even gone into GTA Online in a long period of time (why would you anyway) what with FiveM being a feature and all.Anyway in conclusion it's an alright game car boat and plane/helicopter physics leave a lot to be desired compared to GTA IV's (well except GTA V has planes GTA IV didn't because *cough*9/11*cough*). Story is slightly above average but absolutely does NOT come any close to being as good as GTA IV's story and GTA San Andreas's.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is astonishingly annoying. How about make a game where you can actually play and have fun rather than sitting there and doing the same damn thing over and over again for HOURS just to make enough money to buy a car you could get easily off the side of the street. And this car you now have that you wasted your money on just sits there in the same spot no matter what until you spend ANOTHER 7 HOURS doing the same mission over and over again to buy a garage that holds 2 cars (if you're even lucky enough to afford two). Theres heists that can make you lots of money but those also take time and the NPC's you fight in them have perfect aim which makes it really difficult to complete them. Don't get me wrong this game has great content and im glad that rockstar adds new content still. But the fact that a reliable car costs you hours worth of grinding is ridiculous and it's getting on my nerves. If you want to be able to afford anything in online mode look for a modder because it'll take you weeks to afford some of the essential items in this game.The Online community in this game is THE WORST i have ever experienced in my entire life. Good luck finding a lobby that doesn't have some toxic 12 year old who gets amusmant out of off everyone in the lobby and then says "XD kid ur so bad LOL". I have never played a game with a more toxic community and it really ruins the game. I've spend the majority of my time in that game looking for a lobby that i can actually play in without being shot down by a tryhard in a hydra every 30 seconds.Story mode has some issues too. The story is just you running around killing people while listening to lester or whoever it is tell you where to go if you're too lazy to look down at the minimap in the corner. Modding singleplayer is tricky and you risk breaking the game quite a bit. It's not simple like a lot of other games and it requires a lot of digging into the files. It would be much easier if rockstar just made their own modding API.This game is alright if you can afford things and have fun with them in online mode and if you know how to mod singleplayer. If you can't do either of those then don't waste your money.

review: This game is a must buy for the PC version of this game even if you bought it on the 360 and the One and now the PC like I have. This game feels right at home on PC and runs very well. It's a big beautiful world that you should experience. Probably one of my favorite open world games of recent years.But how is the performance of this game? Well I have a GTX 1080 so you would expect it to run well but it's actually super optimized even if you have a weaker GPU. If you have Intel HD Graphics though I say you should not buy this game because I heard this game won't even launch if it doesn't detect a graphics card. But I may be wrong so do so as you please and then request a refund from steam. But so far I haven't had any frame drops but have had crashes. This game doesn't crash all that often but if you have mods it definitely does. (Make sure you only use mods in singleplayer)Overall I say you should definitely buy this game if you never tried it or even if you have previously bought it for a console. The price tag is worth it just for the story mode alone and online is pretty fun with friends. Overall I say this game is a 9/10. Knocked a point off because online is screwy with modders and the overpriced items. Also they got rid of account transfers some time ago so you will have to restart your online character. Really gonna miss my level 200 Xbox account (

review: AN HONEST TO NO GOD REVIEW!!!Keep in mind this is a SinglePlayer review using keyboard and mouse only! I refuse to play online and don't want to use my XBox controller (sue me plebs).Also a review of only a 4 hour gameplay (but it's worth it dannit!...cause I've seen so much in those 4 hours).The singleplayer is fun don't get me wrong. I waited a long while before buying it...and this is the first GTA game I've ever played...just want to throw some pros and cons out there for the single player prospects trying to decide if the game is worth their time.I have what's called the "Pros cons and peeves". And here are the peeves first...(negative to positive...cause that's how I roll)...TL DR See "PROS" at the very bottom. Everything else is for laugh factor albeit true at the same time but in no way will affect your enjoyment of the game.PEEVES You can't just simply RESTART a mission. It's like some backasswards menu configuration. You have to LOAD a save then start the mission again. I'm trying to get the proper "checks" on each mission. One time my car flipped over while trying to 100% the first mission and I wanted to restart and it said "cannot restart mission while currently in a mission". That's what the d(f)uck a RESTART option is for!!! I feel like I'm the only one NOT taking crazy pills here. I simply talked to a female cop and she and her partner wound up arresting me. For what?!...I didn't do anything else. First of all I kinda see the "struggle" here as a black man interacting with the world (sarcasm) but second of all come on!...don't tell me that my character saying "What's up wit u?" deems an arrest. If this game taught me anything it's don't talk to the cops...fr fr (more sarcasm??? IDK). Politics aside it's the honest to god truth with this game. Can't even talk to a woman on the street corner without her calling the cops on you so don't bother (#metoo) (#truestory). After you get wasted or arrested your clothes change when restarting (at least mine did...EVERY TIME!). And where's my d(f)ucking car afterwards? Spent 30 minutes (no joke) getting chased by the cops while trying to avoid them and get to my safe house after getting arrested from talking to that feminazi female cop. Went to get my first haircut and accidentally selected an option I didn't want for $200 and never got a confirmation message. Lost $200. "ARE YOU SURE?"...is that so hard to include in the game? You give me a confirmation for everything else...inclucing exiting the game. I'd think you can give me a confirmation for a d(f)ucking haircut! AND HERE'S THE BIGGEST THING THAT PEEVES ME OFF!!! If you beat someone up cops SWARM you within seconds. But when you're driving crashing into other cars running people over and running constant red lights...no cops to be found? It just doesn't seem right to me. Unbalanced?CONS I feel like I moved to a new city and still trying to get used to the environment. I don't want to move again ( Driving mechanics on a keyboard and mouse are actually pretty good but don't expect to master them right away. It'll take time to get used to it. It's a bit confusing controlling a vehicle and viewing your perspective with the mouse at the same time. Would be nice if the mouse controlled steering (this is why it's my CON). Some key bind specific mission objective messages dissapear too quickly. I had no idea how to tow the car in the second or third mission and had to restart just to see the prompts again. I am NOT blaming this on me drinking! It should be available at all times during the mission! Where do you go to rob a bank? I need money for my strippers dannit!!! I'm rollin' with $38 dollars right now (and that's due to me spending that stupid $200 on a haircut I didn't want). And in the 4 hours I've played so far only 1 person I jacked gave me money (and it was that d(f)ucking $38 I have!). Don't tell me nobody carries cash anymore. Every mission seems like a driving simulator. Drive here. Chase this guy down. I mean I get it's an open world environment but couldn't they do something different every now and then? Mix things up a little?TL DR...PROS Great voice acting. Great story. Strip club does not charge a cover. Fluid controls! Whether you're playing with a K&amp M or controller you can't deny the controls are good...either way. With K&amp M you might have to get used to the mechanics of driving the various vehicles but I think it's a disadvantage that's easily overcome.SUMMARY...GTA V is an awesome singleplayer game with LOTS of content based on the decisions you make. It's definitely worth the asking price (I bought it on sale for $15.00).Despite it's flaws I would still reccommend this game as a much have purchase. The flaws are not a big deal...just a slight inconvenience to people like me who complain about everything. I basically just expressed to you all my frustrations because I have no outlet in real life /
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. Grand Theft Auto was one of the first games I played when I was young and was my favorite series and is still till this day. The storymode is long amazing and fun. I have only 40 hours on the game (mainly on storymode) and I still havent finished the story yet. I would recommend this game it's beautiful and have a fantastic story. I may not be that active on online on pc but I am sure it feels the same as on console (i own it on console too). The only negative thing I would say is that it takes a while to go to online and sometimes (or most of the time) kicks me out of online for no particular reason but from what I know it might be relating to my NAT Type but everything else of this game is brilliant. I recommend it. Also all the DLCs are free unlike other games where you have to pay for the DLC. Good stuff just my connection to online servers have issues.

review: The game is good but I don't like the fact that sometimes buying vehicles actually made you stronger. For people who don't like to pay money this is a disadvantage for them. It costs time to grind for money and when you buy something you just gotta have to do it again and again. Wasting money on businesses to make more money but you just receive very little amount. And the amount of hackers gosh! I hate them so much. Rockstar you need to do something. Like every single server has them and they messed up my game everytime. I got put into cages where I cannot move. I got a toilet put on my head. I got a ferris wheel stuck in me that causes lag. I got tossed around. I got killed for whatever I do. Even when I do missions they will always annoy me and causes me to fail that mission. By the way the game lobby is just horrible. You could literally wait for hours and hours but nobody would join. I've got many heists that people never joins. Not even a single person. It almost seemed like if the missions are no longer fun it gets forgotten. So please if you would consider to buy this you would regret it or enjoy it. review: This game is a triple A game and revels in that fact. It's proud of its glamour and it still holds up to this day especially the physics which are the best I've ever seen in a video game. The first person mode is also a great addition and for a 2013 game it looks fantastic. Finally the game has some minor RPG elements which I also appreciated. The stat gain is a little pointless and unnecessary but the ability to choose your heist members and have them effect the outcome of your heists is AMAZINGLY well done and adds a lot of replay value to what is for the most part a linear game. All in all there's not as much to actually do in this game as it seems at first but there's still enough for this to be a decent 9 for me.

review: At first i was stunned by this game its huge and very detailed. There are puns everywhere many of them simple jokes but some of them realy touch on issues of nowadays.So first ten hours was like doing some mission then just drivearound and having field trip. Looking at pedestrians listen to their mobile discussion. Then the next 20 was the main story with most of the side missions. It was good sometimes the dialoges are too much but all in all i had my fun out of this.So after this i tried multiplayer and damn it is bad. Its the worst kinda multiplayer where you have to pay to get stuff that makes you more powerfull then otherplayers but doesnt realy give you any goal to achive. So most of the time peoples just fliyng around on the maps on some sort of a motojet and killing other players becouse they payed for that motojet and they will rubb it under everyone noises that they are pathetic. There are of course missions in multiplayer and you can buy buildings go racing and stuff. But this s with there toys will try ruin your fun so you might feek just as miserable as they are. I would advise against any money spent on multiplayer stuff its just a joke.But all in all the game is real good if you liked san andreas go get it.

review: The game is a mess of bugs and I have spent probably half my time in loading screens. Adding to that my second day of playing the online mode resulted in gaining a condition called "Bad Sport" where you are unable to play with anyone except for other people with that label for 2 days on your first time recieving this condition. This is designed to prevent griefers from disrupting other players which would be fine but there is no way to appeal this and rockstar's own matchmaking system promotes gaining this feature. There are two ways to gain this feature griefing and being voted off or leaving jobs. Rockstar says that this is supposed to be in the middle of the game but I have been voted out of lobbies twice in two days and left only in the lobby screen. Other than that I have had internet trouble once whereafter I recieved the affect. This game needs significant work for one that's been out for so long there is no easy way use certain featues as well. All this and I lost 4+ hours worth of story mode to data corruption.

review: In regards to modding single player Modding this game is a real chore for some mods. I have been experienced in modding for a while Fallout Skyrim DoW half life you name it. But damn nothing could prepare me for how complicated it was to simply add a custom made mod car to the single player. The program you have to use the way you have to change your files was so overwhealming i just couldn't do it.I ended up refunding the game because through tryign to install like 3 mods i went down such a rabbit hole undoing all of the mods i had put in place would have been an absolute nightmare. Meaning I couldn't play online or I whould surely be banned. So unless you have the patience of a monk you're going to have a bad time modding maybe not so much if you are patient and you get the hang of it and know where everything is/goes. Not to say the mods for this game are bad the custom cars weapons and scripts rival the made my proffesional game companies.This is just my experience with modding. Yours can be diffrent it just depends oon how far you're willing to take your mods.The base game is pretty good I played it for a while on xbox and then on PS4 and I remeber enjoying it very much. The online was a mixed bag on one side there a lot of stuff to get and you want to get it/experience it all. But on the other hand it an absoulte grind to get even some median stuff. Unless of course you're willing to shell out mad cash on shark cards. Anyway overall i'd give GTA 5 a 7/10.

review: GTA V may has the most variety of possible gamemodes within it's online mode. The singleplayer mode ist quiet good but the core of unlimited fun is deep in the multiplayer. You can do nearly everything with your friends. After some time you will notice that there is a very good playtime to spended cash ratio. I highly recommend this game! UPDATE I purchased this game for the PS3 the PS4 and the PC and I am sure there are more people like me. In total I have a couple of thousands of hours on record and always loved spending this time in GTA Online. But as years go by one can feel that GTA online slowly reaches the end of it's lifespan.The economy transformed into an uncontrolled inflation where multiple million GTA$ won't be enough to buy basic things.Playing this game feels like working for the money at some points.Don't get me wrong! I sure like playing GTA even in these chaotic times. If you got some friends with spare time to play GTA you will explore insane scenarios story driven missions new characters with own storys and much more. You could even build your own criminal empire from scratch. Despite tha fact that you get a petty black haw down like situation every time a modder enters your session...All in all you can get a slightly aged game with decent performance and a lot of fun. Just keep in mind that GTA is in the race for a couple of years now and you will face plenty of oldtimers with a whole arsenal of stuff to keep you annoyed

review: EDITED ON DECEMBER 2018 tried this game again. beautifully enchanced gilttered with CHEATER. Went on a room with 20 players ish waiting for turn in arena battle. Suddenly everyone dead and game did not proceed had to force quit. Either bad UI design (no explanation) or cheater.This game actually a good game but in the end you'll need ingame money which will take hours of gameplay to get medium amount of money. And in this game you NEED lotsa money to enjoy more content. Why? Because you wanna look cool and rich after spent lots of hours in this game.EDIT ON APRIL 2018 Here's the truth of the game that I'll show to you.Never played this game again.This game has led into circle get money/grind hours on it &gt spend it on items &gt need more money for new update &gt get money and grind again &gt repeatCheaters/hackers ROAM online. A friend and steam user told me this Cheaters got banned they will re buy the game and guess who got the profit? You guess it yourself. Real/original cheaters also get the real money from non cheaters player that buy the cheat/service to get in game money. Repeat the step to get infinite money. Who in this world wants to grind for 1 2 hours just to get VIRTUAL money? Even in the store page says "Money is king in Los Santos" so you definitely need in game money. BUT... (read more below)Definitely not a game for those who has a steady work hours/full time job (like 7 hours a day). You grind money in real life then you grind money again in GTA Online (definitely not worth it).Where's your time for doing fun in this game (I'd rather get twice or more the fun in playing other games rather than this frustrating game where loading times are slow as heck and disconnected players that can ruin the fun) ? Or time for family that gets older? Or find yourself a lover and invest time and money for the future? How about rest? Sleeping? Exercise? Finding balance in the life? You can't get that if you play for grinding. Yes sure you can have fun in game without collecting money and just play games casually (which I can do it in another game that gives moar fun and no more loading simulator!) but in the end you will at some point decide to get some money just because you want to look cool (like having that new expensive bunker or yacht) but that's all.After so far playing this game it has come to that point of cycle I mentioned above. So I decided for now I will stay away from the game. Seeing this game has bad reviews now shows the truth of what really happened. Players got power and dev's cant just do whatever they want. It WAS a good game but if you indulge deeper and experience more you'll know and experience something others may not (eventually you'll find yourself in that circle). Check the other reviews to see what I meant.Oh! And the crew. Finding a good solid crew is a major game changer. But a good solid crews require your attention on the rules and time in the game. Example you need to report to them and ROCKSTAR everytime you get hacked/cheated on. Why? BECAUSE IT'S THEIR RULES and if you want to keep playing on the community you need to follow on. Come on who wants to follow super strict rules and not having fun? That's no my style so I left the crew.Other example you need to be online once a week or once a day and play with crew. Most time I encountered with crew needs more than 2 3 hours. Spend at least 1 hour waiting for heist crew ready by doing other activities 1 hour for serious profitable heist (not including disconnected players and long loading times) and 1 hour for screwing around having fun. Point is you need to spend a lot of time in this game to get the content of the game (cars house bunker etc) and to reach that you need a frustrating way up top. I have no crew left because all of them left the game because of technical issues and grindy gameplay. When I got new crew they got super strict rules that limits my gaming experience. Next I got a more casual crew but none shows up. I'm stuck in a loop again. ROCKSTAR needs to review their grinding thingy and make money MUCH more easier to earn money ( by easy I mean 10 minutes game gets you 1 5million) then I bet players will come back.ORIGINAL REVIEW Where should I start? GTAV has everything. FPS ? Got it. Racing?Got it. Heist? Got it. Stripclubs? Got it.Fun mission? Free roam? Crazy stunts? Aerial stunts? Parachute action? GTAV has it all.Grab some friends and go crazy!Pros +Free to do anything+Has lots of stuff (racing shooting closed room missions melee combat aerial combat your own mansion etc)+Constant updates+Detailed missions and environmentsBIGGEST Cons Loading simulator (so slow). Appereantly everyone has this issue and nothing to do with SDD and internet connection. Game is totally frustrating if you try to finish a heist/mission and have no known friends (or playing with random) where you gotta find player for several minutes. Then get into the game. When you almost finished the job a player can left the game (restart the mission) dies (restart the mission) disconnected due to error (restart the mission) trolling and killing others (restart the mission) and so on. When a player disconnects on a mission the game is abandoned/failed. Developers need to learn from DOTA 2 mission kept going and lost players can reconnect. Or simply make other players able to join the session like Killing FLoor 2POINT IS It is totally frustrating to play with RANDOM to do a serious heist missions. Yes there are some good players but kinda rare. Go get a crew (preferably known friends) of more than 4 and play with them. Play with REAL FRIENDS not RANDOM. The UI still can be fixed. Some weakness I need to press several buttons just to access a bank and store money (MAKE IT SIMPLER PLEASE). Until now I dont know if we can add favourite in game web link to the homepage or not. Rockstar try to hire someone who specializes in HUMAN COMPUTER INTERACTION and see what you guys can do to cut down menu selection (it takes couple of steps to do some action which should be simpler.) Let them play for several hundreds hour and take note of their feedback.OVERALL SCORE GAMEPLAY 90/100 GRAPHIC 90/100 OPTIMIZATION 70/100 (well known as FOREVER Loading Simulator)STORY N/A (did not progress far in offline game)

review: This is one of the most fun games I have I have never had so much fun in a video for a very long while.I do not see why there are any negative reviews in general on this game to be fair I think lowering the price to 29 99 was not needed I do know that they lowered it because the game is getting old and they need to make money. I have bought the game on Xbox 360 and pc and that's 110 I do not regret buying this at all I have spent so many hours into this game and I have never been thinking about a refund.It is so much you get from the game it is insane first of all you get the main part of the game story mode (singleplayer) and there is a lot of work put into the story and the design and there is nothing to say about GTA 5 story mode that is bad. When you get tired of singleplayer you can search up cheat codes and that is a fun experience you can go immortal skydiving to spawning in an attack helicopter!The GTA 5 online experience is awesome all though there are many things I don't like about online.Just GTA 5 online is awesome but the community is not the best there is way too many moders and people that hack to get money. I find it is unfair that most of the people are just money dropping and me and other legit people are trying to grind for money. In 2014 when I started to play online (on xbox360) I was having a great time! There was a lot of stuff to do heists missions and races I mostly did missions and heists because I thought they were the most fun ones. I would say I spent around 1000 hours on xbox360 and I was over rank 100 and I was getting to the point I was stopping to play the game. But after 8 months I buy GTA 5 on pc in 2015 and oh boy the game was improved the graphics had never been better than before. The game had first person now and I thought that was amazing I always wanted it on Xbox. In 2017 i think Rockstar Games got way to excited and made to many unbalenced vheicles. When you go onto GTA Online today there will always be someone in a overpowerd vheicle dont get me wrong i think they are awsome but they just are way to unbalenced for new players. Many people who owns these havn't even worked hard for them when someone spawn kills me with a opresor mk2 i often look at their playtime and it is often 50 hours only meaning they have gotten money dropped and i think that is bad game design that new players are just cheating. Reason i never fall for money dropping is because i feel like there is no point of the game is i own everything. That's what many new people think about and rockstar should really get a better anti cheating sytem. But at the end of the day i will always like this game I have had so much fun with friends on GTA 5 Online.In general i think the game is amazing.9/10Pros.Great storyAmazing graphicsSo many carsMassive open worldOnline Missions HeistsRacesCar physicsAdicitingCons.To many modersUnbalenced vheicles and weaponsBest way for me to describe this game.There is so much in this game it would take days.

review: I really really really regret buying anything from this Garbage company. They have not shown any respect to PC owners for a decade now and it started with the first Red Dead Redemption. Apparently GTA IV had been sold across regions for a very low price or something and had been pirated a lot (which it may have been because it was a filthy port which never got fixed by Rockstar? and as for regional pricing it was new back then) No matter what the reason the head of Rockstar lost his and said something along the lines of "PC gaming can burn in hell" and we have been seeing the direct result of that attitude in how Rockstar releases its games. The first Red Dead Redemption game had a very troubled development cycle but many games through that and still manage to get ported on multiple platforms. Their excuse that code for RDR1 is very messed up and would be a pain to port on PC is BS at least as far as I am concerned. Many games even have seperate builds for PC's and Consoles but Rockstar never wanted to release it for the PC because hurr durr piracy and thats the simple reason it didnt come on the PC!Next it was GTAV's turn to not be released on the PC but this time they had a very profitable online model which they realised would be what would make them the big money and because its a perfect fit for PC it was after more than 2.5 years of begging and groveling by PC gamers like yours truly ported on to the PC but only after the new consoles were launched and they could time the release with the release on newer consoles.And now its RDR2's turn and once again they have done what virtually no other third party developer does in this day and age which is to develop a game for both consoles but not on the PC and once again PC gamers (this time not me) are begging them for a port and it sickens me that despite them not having any respect for us we still beg them to throw their scraps at us!!It may or may not come on the PC but that depends on how well the online mode does for RDR2 consoles and weather they feel that they can make enough money with it on the PC BUT the only moral thing to do as a PC gamer is to not buy the game as a screw you to Rockstar for treating us like ! That doesn't mean you can't play it though cuz its completely ethical when it comes to a greedy slimy company like Rockstar (wink wink)P.S making people buy multiple copies is not something they care much about imo... they can ban cheaters hackers etc all year long on PC and they keep buying new copies to play... Its really the sweet sweet recurrent spending on mtx money they are really after and they may decide that RDR online will not generate enough $ on the PC and still not worth it and I hope it doesn't!! The less people play their games the happier I will be from now on!!

review: Lots of text.Firstly cons. After playing the first month in GTA 5 Online in a solo (!) I can write my subjective analysis. The game becomes boring for 2 weeks. Passing the same missions every day inadequate players modders and so on start to get annoying. As for inadequate players and modders read later. In my experience at the beginning of the game many players are not quite friendly to beginners so who is going to buy it immediately I warn you that criticism of your actions will be almost constant until you understand what to do at all. However if you will find a crew or some friendly company/friend then I think that you will get around these problems. Also with regards to financial problems. I can write only one thing you have to constantly save on everything. If you will buy any expensive objects (cars apartment office club etc.) at the beginning of the game then you will simply become bankrupt in the very first days. Therefore you need to spend a lot of time in the game to get enough amounts of money (ie as many have already written grind) however if you are willing to spend real money then everything that was written above does not make sense. I did not "blow up" due to the lack of fancy and expensive cars airplanes or any vehicles therefore I spent the minimum amount of money on it and I had enough with free cars from Rockstar so I don t complain about it. Returning to the text above about modders and inadequate players (killers) it will be obvious in the first week in the game that there are a lot of them. Be prepared that you will be disturbed and killed everywhere even in places where you do not expect that you will be killed and you will get angry (prepare your nerves). For example when leaving home or entering during the missions in stores during a calm purchase of something after missions (past teammates) during a riding somewhere (the probability of a vehicle blowing up with you will be 80% depending on online) unless you decide to change session. Also do not forget about modders since they have a great mission to mock the players with any methods that you ever had in your brain. Although it is possible that UFO lovers might like it.About the pros. Lively and funny character dialogues different missions fun with friends (if you have) and a story mod gives you an immersion into the universe of GTA 5 where you can enjoy the whole gameplay by yourself and decide for yourself whether you want to continue your adventure online or not.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Warning LOADS OF READING TO DO There are times when I look at Los Santos and think 'why would you even think to build that?' This is appropriately a thought that I often have about Los Angeles. In GTA 5's case the tone is different baffled wonderment as opposed to baffled y'know despair. Rockstar have created one of the most extraordinary game environments you will ever visit. I look at it and I wonder at the vast expense of effort required to render every trash bag in every back alley just so. I marvel at the care evident in San Andreas' gorgeous sunsets in the way that sunglasses subtly alter the colour balance of the world in the artfully chosen selection of licensed music designed to accompany your experience. Everything about Los Santos demonstrates the extraordinary amount of thought and love poured into it by hundreds of developers over many years. The abiding irony of Grand Theft Auto 5 is that everybody who actually lives in Los Santos hates it there.Specs Minimum specifications OS Windows 8.1 64 Bit Windows 8 64 Bit Windows 7 64 Bit Service Pack 1 Windows Vista 64 Bit Service Pack 2(NVIDIA video card recommended if running Vista OS)Processor Intel Core 2 Quad CPU Q6600 2.40GHz (4 CPUs) / AMD Phenom 9850 Quad Core Processor (4 CPUs) 2.5GHzMemory 4GBVideo Card NVIDIA 9800 GT 1GB / AMD HD 4870 1GB (DX 10 10.1 *11)Sound Card 100% DirectX 10 compatibleHDD Space 65GBDVD DriveRecommended specifications OS Windows 8.1 64 Bit Windows 8 64 Bit Windows 7 64 Bit Service Pack 1Processor Intel Core i5 3470 3.2GHZ (4 CPUs) / AMD X8 FX 8350 4GHZ (8 CPUs)Memory 8GBVideo Card NVIDIA GTX 660 2GB / AMD HD7870 2GBSound Card 100% DirectX 10 compatibleHDD Space 65GBDVD DriveIts your choice if you want to get this game but i highly recomnd it add me on steam if you want play togther Rank 505 in Online

review: This game is awful I love Rockstar and I love the story mode for this game.But the online game is so god awful. From constant crashing glitches and a huge price tag on even the simplest of stuff.Pros Fun gameplay Amazing vehicle modification Great story mode Decent Matchmaking Huge map full of stuff to doCons Constant Crashing Several unfixed bugs Obvious artificial grind so you buy shark cards No mod support (we all know that story) Takes ages to get anywhere unless you have a plane or heli God awful flying physics that are damn near impossible to master Constant glitches that force you to restart your game LONG AS F*CK loading screens Annoying phone calls every 5 minutes from someone telling you to buy a bunker or some other overpriced bsOverall a fun game but sadly ruined by a plethora of bugs and annoyances that just don't make this game worth the money. If you decide you really want it get it on sale because this just isn't worth the full price. Come on Rockstar we all know you can do much better.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's Gta V... If you like to blow up this is the game for you. In the ??years this has been out I have never been bored playing it. The world is alive with random new things every day. I can find something new to do each time I start it up. If you are a fan of GTA anything this is the game to have (untill RDR2 comes to PC) on any rig that can run it.
