review: The Story Mode was a fun experience when i played it back on the xbox 360 in 2013 however after buying the game on pc and replaying it you kind of realise that the story wasn't actually that good out of the three characters only one feels like a genuine piece of writing Franklin whereas the other two Micheal and Trevor feel like social commentary rather than GTA characters which describe two sides of what is wrong with the American Dream. However if this games on discount for under 15 then I would say that it is worth the spend if youve never played it if not then not much point. The online is semi cancer with every lobby having a hacker and being such a grind that after 400+ hours of what was very fun i started to question whether i had wasted my time but tbh i love the idea of creating my own gangster/ criminal overlord so the online does fullfill that aspect very well which makes the online a little bit more worth it.7/10.

review: Gta 5 will go down as the best game of 2013. It s unbelievable to think this game was released 8 years ago cause of how good the graphics are and the fact that it s still sitting on the bestselling list despite being so old. The graphics of this game are incredible and the single player is outstanding. The story is so rich in detail and you can choose to play between three players instead of just one. The soundtrack is also astonishing and the voice acting outstanding.However Multiplayer is an absolute s**tshow and Rockstar should really fix the issues that plague Online. The only good thing out of Online are the heists. But even they suck in single player you do everything solo so why do you have to team up with 3 other players in order to finish some silly heist setup? It makes no sense. Appart from hiests Online is unplayable and i wouldn't touch it with a 10ft pole. Its filled with hackers and bugs crawling everywhere and is extremlely pay to win.

review: To preface this review I would like to note that Rockstar support is a joke. The site used to report issues is buggy and can be unable to send reports. Response times are long and they often can only reset accounts rather than actually patching bugs.When I first logged into the game I enjoyed the begining of the story mode and was excited that I decided to buy the game.The following happened 1 hour into my game when I attempted to go to GTA Online.1. Created a character and started up GTA Online.2. Game froze and stopped responding.3. Upon relaunching the game I was informed that my character was corrupted.4. Attempted to overwrite corrupt character game threw out a failure notification.5. Looked online for tips to get around the bug saw threads from over 2 years ago and realized this was a longtime issue.6. After hours of research finally decided to send a support ticket.7. Rockstar's site crashed as I attempted to send the ticket.8. Requested a refund through steam.Waste of time support is a joke bugs are never resolved.0/10 would not recommend.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I Used to Recomend this game and love this game but im Sorry. Unless your buying this game to play it on Singleplayer and only ever on singleplayer then dont buy it. The multiplayer is full of hackers and regardless of what Rockstar say they are doing. They arent. The hackers can now Stop your reports and Ban you on will without fear of rockstar because rockstar have failed to create a functional report system instead they leave it to AI. The Hackers have access to your IP and unless you are using a VPN then your in danger of being hacked. I watched a Hacker tell everyone where they were living in the first lobby ive joined. I thought they fixed this from all the comotion however they havent.So unfortunate that dispicable people ruin such a good game. IT could have been like Cod where you have to buy every expansion but no its not they give out free expansions. If only they skipped one and put that into dealing with the hackers permanently.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Story mode is amazing. Online is just you trying to get on with your whils an taht has bought a jetbike that has got heatseeking guided rockets that cannot be avoided unless you are equiped with flares(that you dont have in most vehicles) the bike has got the flares so you got no way of killing them apart from killing the player he respawns and just calls his bike next to him(that's a feature of the game not a cheat) takes of and continues spawnkiling you. Such fun much wow. Very balanced. Rockstar just added something that they haven't balanced a bit that breaks the immersion AS since having a bike that handles like a jet has got heatseeking missles and flares is something you'd see everyday. (They added flying vehicles with rockets as well.) Such thing never should have made it to FREEROAM. I am fien with these things being in missions where the odds are even or where you use it in coop. But getting constatnly spawnkilled by a kid that just doesn't have to do anything(you just aim the bike in the general direction and press the button to launch a missle it will target and seek the target on its own) is stupid.

review: I explained my stance on singleplayer in my first review. Short version Its pretty good. Rest of this is about onlineWhile new content has been added I still see the same issues with this game. I've owned this since it launched on console and honestly the most glaring issue that I seen with it since the start is the ever increasing difficultly for new players to make it in the game.The problem isn't that players can get access to god tier equipment but that said equipment can be instantly accessed for what is essentially no cost/effort after the inital cost has been paid. Want a tank/jet/apocolypse on wheels? Call it in on your phone. Did it get destroyed? Call it in again... immediately after.Basically high level players get the rewards they deserve but have no limits on how much they can use them. This results in many cases where a low/mid level player will be unable to deal with a high level player even if they manage to kill them.High level players put time/effort into this game and should recieve rewards for such however the current system elevates high level players to a point where it essentially makes them untouchble to those who are not of the same status making online difficult to enjoy for those who are not high level.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Why am I banned?Look at the time of my game and the date of purchase. I only bought the game for less than a month but I was banned tonight. I had a fight with several people this afternoon and soon after I got on the car the battle went wrong and drove me to the offline mode. When I got into the online mode again the game collapsed when I got on the car and was ready to drive the car into the garage. Then at night when I reopened the game I found that I was permanently banned from online mode.I need someone to tell me immediately why this happened. The game was downloaded just a few weeks ago when I bought it. It did not open or violate the rules of the game. Why was it banned?

Mechanics used in some heist are seldom used elsewhere. It can be a bit hard to bond with three characters simultaniously unlike GTA4 which you only had (one) Niko. review: I was expecting a lot when i got this game recently i was expecting a lot and only was surprised with very little. The story mode/single player is alright and the online is meh at best for me at the moment. My biggest issue is that yet another online game that has CRAP for character creations. All female characters look like masculine body builder types even after literally spending 3 1/2 hours in the creation screen. Their stats do nothing on their looks and thought I can get their faces to look less like a nuclear accident to a somewhat plausible woman I watched twenty character creation videos and unlike them my character looks fubared even though following their guides 100% so makes me think that they are using some sort of mods if that is allowed. I know the devs can create some nice looking characters but they force the player base to get the crapfest of a character creation. THey need to take a look at games like Dragon Age Inquisition or Fallout 4 look at how in depth the character creation screens are you can litterally SCULPT the faces or teh character and modify the bodies before accepting the character. IF I was able I would rate this game wiht a negative 5 stars just for crapfest character creation for online

review: I am someone who used to love this game but I don't anymore and my reasons are just the tip of the iceberg so here's why... I'll try to keep this as short as possible but write it so that you can grab something useful from it.First of all I worked as funny as it sounds I worked for 2 years to afford a PC and this game I bought along with it. At the time the price was understandable but now this game should be free to play in all honesty after all they care about microtransactions more then people actually buying the game. This one is the worst one of them too sadly from masterpieces nowadays companies make what was once good back into trash or even worse. Rockstar Games just steal stories from negative stories that they make into theirs from stealing it and make it even worse then it already is. Of course the goal is to make it as fun evil and make the characters seem like they're all superheroes in human form. No wonder the customers become the robotic slaves that Rockstars are themselves. However let's talk about Storymode Online and what I got from this game First a basic overview.Although online mode isn't even worth talking about all you have to do is look at the other reviews and you'll see that Rockstars would grind anyone's knee for real money. Luckily I never fell into that trap but I am here to feel sorry for all those that keep purchasing them. The company finds it funny when people go bankrupt they even show jokes like these hidden in they're hardcore games that are grabbed by idiots like me who just want to have openworld fun in a "limitless world" but no more am I spending money into they're garbage. You just have to look at it a bit more spiritually and you're eyes are opened.Storymode Is worse then any other GTA before. Yeah maybe the experience for the first time can be nice when you blow up someone something or there are nice cutscenes and a criminal dialogue but that's about it.First of all you'll notice that the gameplay is just repetitive it can be fun killing cops for a number of times but even the crouching system is just Instead of being able to hide where you want you are locked to close by objects and instead of hating it people worship it like it's godlike.You have only 69 missions (+ strangers &amp freaks which are even shorter) Along with that although you have 3 characters however 3 characters in only 69 missions doesn't go well but nobody could have known that at the time... You don't have enough time to get to know the characters but in all honesty who would wanna get to know the monsters that are lurking inside not me at the least. Now back to the missions even though they put at least some work into them? Well you'll end up having more questions then answers where people make stupid "What happens" or "Myths" about certain things. Myths is another thing instead of making it as hidden as in GTASA they just end up revealing the whole thing where in GTASA this game still has unsolved mysteries and findings waiting to be solved even today. Sadly masterpieces won't be made anymore from Rockstars and we can prove that by comparing the new games with the old where those always win because the gameplay is simply better.Online Spare me please this has to be the worst online experience I ever had in a game so far first of all the foverly too futuristic vehicles that are in the game are in reality vehicles like that are yet to be revealed to the public but GTA had to of course take one step ahead and cause a war between the players where vehicles is one thing but cooperating and making profit together is a problem too for instance in Facility Heists which is the most nerve racking experience I have ever faced and the most I have ever swore in any game yet literary causing me to go psychotic simply because they made it beyond hard to make any money in... and if you wanna know how then don't forget to play 12 hours a day just to remotely get to where you wanna get... I am not someone who knows how to scam or abuse the system. I am someone who works hard for the money but then the is so expensive... I'll stop there with that because I'd have to blow someone's face off to express what I mean.Don't buy this game at all cost and don't even get it on discount. In fact don't even get it if it becomes free to play this game is garbage.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I want to start off with I m sorry if this is isn t worded in the best way or if I misspell stuff. A few months ago I made the decision that I was going to get VR at the time I had been increadably unhealthy. Shortly after recieving VR GRAND THEFT AUTO THE FIFTH came out and I thought that this game might be a neat little time killer in between other games or when I got bored. Little did I know this one game about hitting blocks in VR would change my life. I m definitely no healthy person by a long shot a few months ago before starting GRAND THEFT AUTO THE FIFTH I was about 330lbs currently I m around 265 and still going down. It would come to no surprise to me if this game has literally saved my life. The amount of enjoyment I ve gotten out of this simple game has been immense. Putting health aside the main reason this game has changed my life is because of the people in this community. I have met some of the most incredible people over the last few months. I ve never felt so at home and involved in a community before. I really do love and care about every single one of you. Thank you all for being amazing people and thank you beat saber for changing my life. Sorry again if this is ill worded or jibberish it s 5am and I felt like I really needed to get this out there.

review: UPDATE These idiots sitting in a cubicle banned my account without offering any evidence whatsoever and then have the nerve to tell me I can't appeal it. this company honestly.Overall a good game I'd pay no more than $40 given some of its core issues connection is no longer server based but P2P which explains some of the ridiculously long loading times. you're often matched with foreigners when you try to lobby up for setups/missions. I've nothing against them except for the fact that they're laggy af to play with the ING oppressor mark 2. Very few viable countermeasures especially if you're on your own. The homing on that is absurdly powerful would be great if the handling got heavily nerfed along with the lock on range and homing ability so that there's some actual risk to using that to duel players rather than throw a missile or two and be miles away by the time they respawn calling in your helicopter spawns it over a mile and a half away half the time even when there's a perfectly good helipad right near you (e.g. on top of office). It's somewhat understandable in freemode but dispatches heists and other missions? Really? one of these days you'll buff the Cargogbob out of it's semi useless state. It can only pick up a small selection of vehicles and what's WORSE you can't pick up a vehicle unless you or your teammate get in it for at least a split second. It'd be cool if you offered a major upgrade like a longer hook or that big magnet and even a hint of added mobility and/or countermeasure buffs.Like I said though in spite of these issues I'd still recommend it especially at its $15 sale point. Loads of fun and still a very active playerbase playing online.

review: Audience Beginner Casual Gamer Normal Gamer Expert Graphics Bad Alright Good Beautiful Fantastic Music Bad Alright Good Beautiful Fantastic Difficulty Easy Average Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard Unfair Bugs Bugs destroy the game Lots of bugs Few Bugs You can use them for speedrun Nothing encountered Story There is none Bad Alright Good Fantastic Gameplay Frustrating Sleepy Boring Fun Challenging Game time / Length Really short (0 3 hours) Short (4 8 hours) Few hours (10 20 hours) if you focus on the main story Long (40 60 hours) if you complete everything Very Long (61 100 hours) Extremely Long (101+ hours) $ Price / Quality $ Full price Wait for Sale Don't buy Refund it if you can Text Review GTAV is an amazing world every corner meticulously crafted with love every personality given life. The main story is amazing and can be played however you like or not at all. You could just play online the entirity of your GTA life. The story should be experienced at least once by everyone though it really is a masterpiece. I recommend the game just for that solely but you're probably wondering about the multiplayer so here we go.The multiplayer of this game is a double edged sword while with a friend or two or even alone you can always find something and someone to do something with the game has been out for many years and to keep it relevant powercreep has taken a huge toll on the balance of the game. A tank used to be the sign of a powerful and rich player now you're lucky to drive 10 feet in a tank without dying to agile flying machines that can one shot you and guns that laugh in the face of a tank turret.Though you can have sooooo many fun toys gliding or flying through the skies on an Oppressor is simply one of the best feelings you can have in a game the absolute absurdity and freedom is so much fun but getting there is the elephant in the room no one wants to talk about to new players.It costs a ridiculous amount of grinding to get to the good stuff hundreds of hours of tolerating s who want to tear you a new one every 15 seconds just because you exist while you try and sell some guns or drugs to get enough money for that new upgrade or vehicle. Or you can take the whale route and have everything right away and become a menace to the server for a quick and easy few hundred dollars of your own hard earned money.The game is best enjoyed with a couple of friends riding together taking a server by storm or just completing missions at your own pace the heists for example pay a lot of money require good teamwork and are very enjoyable albeit frustrating and a little random at times.Absolutely recommend this games' single player and multiplayer as long as you have friends or money to get to the good stuff fast.

They could have fixed this by adding a sandbox multiplayer mode where you have access to everything so you can have fun or by adding the multiplayer stuff to single player but instead it's all about the money. The multiplayer is rigged to make you buy shark cards and is riddled with hackers/modders and people that do nothing but kill others for no real reason. Also the only way to make money is play in these lobbies with these a holes.I recommend buying on sale for single player but not for multiplayer.

review: As literally the most profitable game EVER this game should not and does not fall short of the hype. Even 5 years after release constant updates and packed multiplayer servers is what makes this game unique. I mean just stop for a second and think. Try to think of 1 other game that lets you actually do ANYTHING you want. ANYTHING. It's a combination of Forza Horizon Call of Duty Flight Simulator Payday and more all merged into one huge optimized and fun game. Yes it's rated M and that is probably it's only downside. But after I played it it's not that difficult to steer clear of the "M" content. The only thing you can't get away from is cursing but you just gotta deal with it if you want to have the most fun you will ever have in a video game. I bought it on sale but sale or not this is one of the most entertaining games of all time.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Anyone can run this game. It's really fantastic how compatible it is. I played it on integrated graphics with a processor that would fail 1st grade math class. Granted with a less than able computer you'll have to use the lowest graphics settings and play on a window that contains less pixels than your smartphone while still getting low FPS. But that's the beauty of the game. It doesn't lose the aspect of playability even when played on a rotten potato. As for the gameplay itself well... its a GTA game sooooo.... But there's plenty to keep you busy for hundereds of hours. Not to mention the fantastic replayable story. But in the very rare case that you may become bored with this game there's always tons of community created mods to keep you interested. From new cars and player models to new locations and missions. The modding community has a bunch of stuff to offer.GTA Online is something I am not as familiar with. Although for the little time I spent there I was already dying randomly... as well as everyone else in the game. But the singleplayer mode keeps me busy enough so I usually stay in that. But it's up to you to decide what part of the game you like the most. All in all this game is definitely worth the price.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Product received for free. This is my review for GTA OnlineThis game is amazing if you had started before all of the expensive DLC's came out and had money built up along the way. Otherwise this is not the game for you. It's now become extremely hard for newcomers to gain any cash to get by in this game because of the overly expensive prices of in game items as well as the tryhards and KD warriors who constantly roam around sessions prancing on low levels. The only realistic method of gaining decent cash is through the heists but even then it's hard to complete because of the amount of people required and the lack of incentive for more experienced players to go play them. If you have money to spare for the Criminal Enterprise Starter Pack then do consider spending the extra cash as your GTA Online experience will be significantly worse if you don'tIf you have friends who play the game and are willing to help you grind then by all means go for it. This game is amazing when you have people to play with even if you start playing at this point. Otherwise the solo experience as a new player right now is not great.However if you intend on playing Grand Theft Auto V Story Mode then go ahead. I had a blast playing through the story mode.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There are many problems with GTA5. The character movement vehicles controls and health system are terrible. When trying to play GTA Online other players will harass and bully you. The report system does nothing. The online portion has been pathetically implemented. Players can kill other players in free roam with no consequences. High level players can destroy newer ones with ease. Better yet when they kill you you spawn right next to where you died so they can kill you again. This game facilitates borderline criminal levels of harassment. Also there are missions to do in free roam than can pay out a couple hundred thousand credits that usually involve selling things from your properties but someone can come and destroy it all instantly. In other words this game is trash.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I still go online every other day and enter a lobby where I am killed by either a hacker who joins and types that everyone will burn and then kills everyone and leaves not once or twice but five or 6 times or there are the tryhard brats who have dropped money and just buy the MKII oppressor and kill everyone there is no counter to said bike and a public lobby is the only way to make lots of cash fast with the Bunker so no I do not say buy this game unless you want to practice making a mod or hack that easily gets through R* oh and you cant even type the word Rockstar in an online lobby Original Well I still have few complaints about this game since launch. I guess the story content was alright but it's not worth AAA prices anymore (let alone Shark Card prices). Online is basically one great dumpster fire of modders griefing in Godmode as described above and an incredibly forceful microtransaction marketing strategy because of hyperinflation by a greedy publisher. Avoid Like the Plague

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is one of the defining games of the 2010 decade both for being a magnificent environment to traverse around and a disappointing abused cash cow culminating into the most profitable game ever as of 2018.Singleplayer story mode is a strange tale of three characters who navigate their less than tranquil lives into high stake crossover crimes ultimately parodying some of real American experience and an egotistical culture which is transforming with new technology into something worse. The result what this game should really be like with all of its bells and bruises. However having replayed this recently some of the mission timings are off and some collection missions are just plain stupid.Multiplayer in the form of GTA5 Online is a shadow of its former self rich but you must be time and 'money' rich to try and even begin enjoying it. Once upon a time there was 'hardly many' assests worth having and now there are 'many fine' additions to the game with each taking a very long means to get to. CEO businesses a good idea in theory have arbitrary costs and running costs to prevent players wholely enjoying them often with stupid wait times to profit off of them too. But in reality they pay out more under normal conditions than what the grindy instanced missions do just not enough for any meaningful length of time. Don't worry though the game will keep bugging you until you decide to buy all of the new updated stuff! Also adding hackers into the mix who can frequently pop up in public lobbys (which don't even have true dedicated servers they try to work it from your router) makes this game more of a free for all than what its own parametres should allow for. Sure they get banned and sure they give out free stuff every now and then but Rockstars management of the game has left much to be desired from what is suppose to be the defining 'live a life of crime in style' game of this decade. After all you can just buy another account on sale if you want too after getting banned (even incorrectly with resolution as some have claimed) even if you're too young legally!If anyone wants a snapshot as to why the PC port of this game just doesn't mesh well too all you have to do is consider the 'new' arena style update which handles bad like punching in a dream with cotton arms whilst looking aesthetically unpleasing. On top of all the other problems mentioned above of course.To conclude I'll finish this review with this comment. Someone once said that it's stupid to dislike a game after having played more than one hundred hours. After all you must've enjoyed it at some stage during that massive amount of time invested. I agree. This game has many gripping moments and experiences that make it one of the best of this decade. But if you want to 'have' more artistic freedom in creating a character and interacting in the online mode be prepared to spend a lot of money time or even both to get anything out of the game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This review will be in parts one for Story Mode and the other for Online.Story Mode Grand Theft Auto V is one of the best GTA's ever made. Not because of story but because of ingenuity. It's the first of hopefully many games to allow you to have 3 main characters that you can switch to and play at any point in time sort of. The game world is one of the biggest maps I have ever seen in a game and it is to scale as well as it takes several minutes when driving full speed to do a full loop. Graphics are another thing. For a game that was released on PC in 2015 almost 4 years later the graphics are still better than most games to date. Not only that but the game runs buttery smooth. If you meet the recommended requirements you will be able to play and enjoy this game. That is mainly because the game engine is amazing. In all my hours playing this game I have hardly ever crashed even with mods. One of the things I loved about GTA 5 was the story mode. I thought it had a great story mode that was accompanied by an even greater interactive game world. For example the in game stock market. If you wanted to make money the stock market was a very good option to do so. You can manipulate it by destroying rival companies products like airlines or trucks. This would end up causing your company to grow. There was also the infamous stock market assasination missions where you could earn millions. The actual story itself was great. The characters all had "character" and while some were comedic like Trevor others were more gritty and serious like Franklin or Michael and I never felt like one character was a carbon copy of another which is good. The story had a very serious feel to it while playing but it never felt like a chore especially with all of the comedic breaks in between. Even playing the story to this day I still find myself laughing at parts because of dialouge or what the mission actually entails.There is much more that I could say about the story mode of GTA V but I typically like to keep my reviews focused on a few really good aspects of the game.Online GTA O has had a very long ride and believe it or not is still active to this day. I have mostly found myself enjoying Online because of a few things. Money cars and grind. I actually enjoy the grinding aspect of this game unlike other people. It is totally possible to buy what you want if you dedicate yourself to working for it. To jump right into it I honestly think more money should be earned from doing missions and selling product but I also think people that complain about other people buying shark cards are overreacting.Shark cards are an in game microtransaction that have been in the game since it was released. I have purchased a few in my lifetime but that's it. In total I have probably spend $100 or less and that's across all platforms since 2013 when the game came out. That was also back before you could own a criminal empire and make money fairly easily so it makes sense. Rockstar has done a fantastic job with keeping this game alive with updates. I always have a period where I stop playing for a while but the updates almost always bring me back.So yeah. I could go on about this game but I would definitely recommend it. The hackers in Online have seemed to die down as of late but you can still run into them every now and then but overall this is a really good game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Honestly I cannot recommend this game to anyone. It has a fine singleplayer campaign that in all honesty is a very good experience with a lot of things to do and explore. Some might get bored after completing it once some might want to 100% it or run tru the game multiple times. But nobody cares for the singleplayer (the devs sure as heck dont) As for multiplayer its a fun experience with a couple of friends but its not something I would call "good" Sandbox is rarely interesting and consists of constant meaningless shootouts with randoms and griefing. While it's expected there's barely anything to do _other_ than that.And everything else you could do is grindy at best. yes you could do cool call of duty style missions with friends shooting npcs and such and get like 20k for each but why would you when your time is best spent grinding either whatever mission gives 2x cash at the moment or doing cargo runs in sandbox for corporations to get even more money. all of that only so that you could buy a boat/plane/tank to use in the sandbox which as i've stated isn't really fun. It's all just a microtransaction scheme regardless. skip this game unless you care for the story and even then i'd rather you wait for a sale or ask a friend to share it rather than giving this company more money.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5An awesome and quality game as expected by Rockstar but it is also marred by boring tedious and outright painful challenges and activities. Where is the fun in collecting over 100 collectibles? The hunting challenges are alright until you meet the 4th photography challenge which will make you rip your head off. The game also lack many quality of life features such as restarting a mission without needing to fail it then exit out of the mission then play it again and collectibles tracker especially with the absurd amount of them.I also do not agree with the way handles additional content. Why do I have to play a previous version of the same game in order to get more content? If I pay for a game I expect to get everything without needing to play a previous version or some other nonsense. Missions are too linear and aren't made to be replayed either but they have these gold medal objectives that forces you do to it if you want to 100% the game. I don't like how police instantly starts searching for you the moment you commit crimes like they are ing ready for it. GTA Online is just a cheatfest so don t bother with it.The Rockstar editor is an awesome addition and many more games should have that but the camera feels too restrictive.Complains aside the game world is stunning even in 2019 standards. The driving and shooting in the game is satisfying the story and missions is interesting when you first play through them. The amount of variations in the side missions are an icing on the cake as well.Overall this game is a very solid game though some aspects leaves to be desired.In depth Review Hours put into game as of writing 76.6Complexity Easy to learn and master Easy to learn but hard to master Hard to learn and masterGame Type Single player only Multiplayer only Single player and multiplayer Mostly multiplayer Mostly single playerBuy at what price? At full price &gt 20% off &gt 50% off &gt 80% off Get it for free Don't even get it when it's freeGameplay 7.9 Mechanics 8 Fun 8 Bugs 9 Interaction 10 AI 9 Length 10 Servers 7 Cheating 2Optimization 10 Performance 10 Port 10Visuals 9.7 Graphics 10 Animation 10 Glitches 9Audio 10 Music 10 Sounds 10 Balance 10 Voice 10Others 8 DLC Microtransactions 8Additional Comments + Open world is full of stuff to do (Fun) Some of the activities are ing tedious and pointless (Mechanics)Final Score 9/10 Awesome(For more information or to post questions click here.)(Scores with more than 2 d.p. (except final score) will be rounded up or down accordingly)Review Version 6

review: The singleplayer mode has a great story that spans across three main characters and overall has great support for mods created by the community. I would highly recommend this game for the singleplayer experience just because of the story but also would recommend only getting it on sale.The singleplayer story is based around three unique characters who you will come to love as the story progresses. I didn't get Grand Theft Auto V right when it was released on PC after being ported over from consoles. So I can't really talk about the experience then but I can talk about it after that since I personally got the game back in November of 2015 which was roughly ten months after its release on PC. However these days upon joining online you are already thrown face first into the wall with abysmally long loading times into multiplayer. Multiplayer sessions are also hosted by individual players through their clients so it is very easy to find out who's hosting your session and DoS/DDoS of them if you please.Once you load into an online session after about a good five to ten minutes of waiting you will be met with the toxic dumpster fire that is the online experience. Modders/Hackers/Cheaters are still a problem after the various ban waves that Rockstar has claimed to have done. They constantly are greifing in online sessions be it either a regular free roam session or a mission They have also just brought the overall feeling of playing online down making it not worth playing in public sessions anymore unless it is a small session which of course will eventually be filled up.Modders have the ability to essentially destroy entire lobby sessions at will. Various abilities such as teleporting everyone spawning objects spawning objects in safe houses (apartments motorcycle clubs offices etc.) and becoming invincible to all damage just to name a few are all available to a modder to use at their consent. There are a few friendly modders out in the GTA Online community that will simply create race/stunt tracks for players or even hand out money however the practices are still shady since some money that modders give players may result in either a character reset or an entire ban from the GTA Online part of the game.Players can avoid being killed and overall abused in public lobbies by entering passive mode via their interaction menu however it will limit what the player can do in terms of what events and positions a player can enter. Passive mode is more of a mode to get from point A to point B if you are just not doing anything. Personally I have used it to just screw around in a session with my car or fly a plane around the map and explore. Passive mode will protect you from any PVP damage however it environmental damage self damage and damage from NPCs for example from the Police will still be able to be dealt to you.Online features more content than the singleplayer experience from new clothes to sweet rides to even new safe houses. However anything that isn't vanilla that has been added in through various 'free dlc' updates have been insanely priced to promote grinding for cash and overall to keep players playing the game. If you don't feel like grinding for money you can fork out some additional money to Rockstar for some of those shark cards with the highest tiered card the Megalodon Shark costing the player $99.99 USD for just a measly $8 000 000 dollars in game that can only buy a few fully modded super cars or a couple of fully decked out buildings. However if the player insists on grinding since they don't want to spend any more additional money on the game so be it.After completing all of the online heists (if you complete them all with the same crew you will be awarded a bonus one million dollars and an achievement if that even matters ) you essentially have nothing left to do. You can create a motorcycle club (MC) in the breaks between heists and overall just while playing in GTA Online and start your grind towards getting Securo Serv (CEO) offices warehouses etc. With the new additions of the bunker and the facilities it provides more areas for CEOs to access and make money through their provided services but only adds to the grind. All shipments of supplies to generate goods for specific MC or CEO industry as well as shipments to deliver said goods for a cash payout must all be done in a public session.Upon deciding to sell stock in a public session you are immediately ousted to the entire lobby with a cargo beacon after a few seconds of stealth time. In public lobbies if one has their shipment destroyed not only do they lose all that potential profit from hours of supply runs but the person(s) who destroyed the supplies or stock will only receive a few thousand dollars as payment. It is more of a joke since not only does it make someone look like a jerk for just screwing with someone else's potential profit but also because they destroyed it and they get nothing but pocket change for it. It is not only an insult to the person for undertaking the task of destroying someone else's stuff but also an insult to the person who was going to deliver the supplies/stock since they screwed someone out of their money after hours of grinding.Rockstar recently added the nightclub feature which allows players to generate a passive income of $40 000 over time just as long as the player is playing the game and has their nightclub popularity up. A bonus with the nightclub is missions to promote the nightclub can be done in private sessions as opposed to everything else being required to be done in a public session. The nightclub also offers a new feature where you can hire up to five technicians (each more expensive than the previous) that can be assigned to certain goods to accumulate which allows the player to stop getting supplies for it. One example would be if a player has a gunrunning bunker they can assign a technician to its good (sporting goods) and the technician will eventually create stock for that good type The player will never need to go get supplies to produce goods as long as a technician is assigned to that goods type. Another thing with the technicians is that if you want to have them produce goods for you to sell you will need to be actively be playing in GTA Online. More info on how nightclub earnings are calculated and generated can be found here.There is a way to create a 'solo' public session that will net the player a few runs of supplies or stock deliveries before any players join however it is more of a rinse and repeat cycle where if the player wants to continually do tasks that must be done in a public session they will find themselves creating a 'solo' public session about every few minutes to up to an hour. This is mainly due to how GTA Online is ran through players' clients. If someone connects you'll need to create a new session if not then you may have to keep checking every few minutes just to make sure you are still alone in your 'solo' public session. However it is rewarding since it allows players to get stuff done in public sessions as required but without the possibility of someone being a jerk and just screwing you over.Other means of earning money through the game are from just playing since if you are a 'good player' you will be awarded a few thousand every once in a while as well as robbing convenience stores. Jobs are also available which may be small side missions or other events such as races minigames etc. that will net you money based on how well you performed either score or position wise. Game lobbies that have at least a minimum of four players also will run freemode events gta.fandom.com every twelve minutes real time such as challenges. 'Achieve the highest number of driveby kills on players.' and 'Fly upside

review: jul 17 2018its GTA V everyone knows what this game is however this version is not the best. if you have a console to play on instead then do it. the singleplayer is not bad however it is hard to mod leaving you with online when your bored of single player. and online is a load of crap. the amount of hackers that i have found that rockstar refuses to do anything about unless they are hacking in money is insane! i have seen flying cars/ tanks a person who got in my car then started changing its colors teleporting players unkillable players the list goes on! the most resent thing to happen to me was that i logged on today and i had a new office... and 1.6 million dolars less (most of my money).Then there is the "keyless glitch" as i call it. for some reason after anywhere from 0 (the loading screen) 10 minutes of playing online or (sometimes) singleplayer my computer acts like i am holding down the windows key. so to use wasd to move dose not work! and if you leave the window the glitch continues! if i leave to go google something for example. and i type "w" it will not type the "w" but instead bring up windows workspace. i do have to say that this glitch dose only happen if i play with a controler so if you use a controler then there is a risk of this glitch happining to you!and my last main complaint is about this game is their sort of way of pushing system controls aside. when the gam freezes you would think to use alt F4 but you would be out of luck because that is just a way to exit the game normaly so if the game itself then it wont work and you have to find a way to exit the window then sometimes it will let you use ctrl shift esc to bring up task manager and close it somtimes you are completely screwed and the only way to stop gta is with a hard shutdown to your computer i give it a 4/102/11/2019all of the issues that i talked about before are still there to the full extent that there were before. and it is dissapointing but not suprising. i dont really have much to add to that but i wall say that i will recomend the game more now than before as i am a bit higher level online and it is much better now. all in all it is still gta v so there is not much to say. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR Buy this game for the storyline and if you like exploring every single place on the map. Don't buy it if you want lots of additional stuff to do after completing the story like in older GTA games.The Online service is Fallout 76 levels of bad if not worse on certain occasions (connection issues long loading screens) and you get a great choice of either hackers or people who purposefully attempt to ruin your fun at a surprisingly frequent rate. If you don't have friends nor do you want to do Jobs don't bother with the Online part of the game.Buy GTA San Andreas. It's cheaper and you get more bang for your buck. REVIEW With that being said here's my review. I'll be comparing this to GTA San Andreas (SA throughout this review) as that was the last GTA game I properly played (I tried out IV for a very small amount of time which isn't enough to compare V to IV).Map The map is beautiful. One of my favorite things in this game is simply to drive/fly around and see how much the graphics department has advanced compared to the days of SA. You don't get three islands anymore but you get a pretty good island. That isn't necessarily a bad thing. Los Santos feels more alive than its predecessor and there are plenty of side activities to keep you entertained.Driving For some reason to me it feels more arcade ish than GTA SA's driving. The handbrake is certainly more powerful meaning that Tokyo Drifting your way through corners like I did with the old Greenwood isn't the best way to do turns here. The arcade side of things is also clear when you realize that you can't flip the car like you could in previous GTA games which sounds great at first until you realize that going out to get another car was one of the main reasons to try to be a good driver. However they decided to add an additional layer of "realism" by... adding health damage when you hit an obstacle. Who thought that it's a good feature to have? It literally ruins riding a bike for me as I feel the need to be excessively careful. It also applies to cars (although it's less sensible fortunately). The ragdoll physics are funny but that does not compensate the loss of good gameplay.Cars You have plenty of variety here trust me. From Smart cars to classic Bugattis I think that it's good enough. Their handling is varied enough so that two different cars don't feel like the same car. You can toggle the convertible top in convertibles which is awesome. I spent more time than I should watching that animation. You can't ride a lawnmower like in SA though.Customization You get plenty of customization options. Although it's still limited in most cars like it was in GTA SA it allows you to do more stuff than it did before. That's a big plus for GTA V as customizing cars can be quite fun. It's not a Need For Speed Most Wanted replacement but more than enough to keep you entertained given that this game isn't a racing game.Police/Cops In older GTA games your car was sort of like a safe spot. They couldn't shoot you through the glass thus the only way for them to kill you would be to blow up your car or let you flip it yourself. Not anymore. They can not only shoot you through glass but also while you're getting into a car. That's a bonus point for realism but it also sort of ruins long pursuits. You rarely get to switch your car and survive unless you've gotten a considerable distance from them. They can also kill you right as you drive off which is quite annoying. It's one of those features that should be enabled/disabled in the options menu the way Mafia 3 did with car handling.What about a motorcycle you ask? You can forget about that. Not only is the police quite accurate at shooting you but they also ram you causing you to fall off your bike. You're only safe out in the open (countryside) or in places the police can't reach you.If you actually managed to evade the overpowered police force you'll enter a cooldown period copied straight out of the Need For Speed Most Wanted book. Which isn't a bad thing at all. If you don't know what I mean you basically need to stay out of sight of police helicopters and vehicles for a certain amount of time. As an added game mechanic you can hide in the shadows in order not to get spotted (although I rarely managed to find one but that's my lack of skill not an issue with the game) and helicopters won't see you in covered surfaces. However the police must be ran by some sort of divine entity as they easily guess where you are sending police vehicles towards your new unknown location. The improved drive by mechanic allows you to shoot police officers while inside their cars and while you are driving in more than just four directions which can be quite fun when you know how to use it and gives pursuits a breath of fresh air.If you're looking for police bribes or for a Pay'N'Spray to save you you can forget about that. There is Los Santos Customs (with an oddly similar icon to the old Pay'N'Sprays) but it doesn't allow you to mod cars if you have a Wanted Level (as far as I recall).As an added note the 6 star Army wanted level is gone which kinda removes the goal of long pursuits (i.e. to get military vehicles).Character(s) It's pretty much a known fact even if you haven't yet played this game that this game has three characters instead of just one. It's one of its selling points.Personally I like them all. The three protagonists' (Trevor Michael and Franklin) personalities are different enough that you don't confuse who they are or feel like they're emotionless husks. The dynamic between all of them feels straight out of a movie and there's lots of story to be told/uncovered throughout dialogs or simply by hanging out with them or doing activities.Trevor is crazy and loyal Michael isn't loyal and gets angry easily and Franklin is... well basically CJ from SA except that he doesn't give a damn about gangs.Watch some cutscenes if you want to know more about how they interact before purchasing the game.Radio Stations Given the fact that they had to work with 2013 as the setting of the game they chose good songs for this game. From Tupac to Queen there are plenty of good songs in this game if you're into older songs. Previous GTA titles may have more songs made during their particular setting (80's and 90's) but it's not a bad soundtrack at all. In fact it's surprisingly above average. I expected it to be a lot worse.Oddjobs/Professions/Stuff to do One of my main complaints about GTA V is the lack of oddjobs. Remember when in SA you could do Paramedic Vigilante Delivery Pimping and Freight oddjobs? Well you can forget about all of those in GTA V. Except Taxi. At least you get Taxi. Thank whoever you want to thank for that. I expected more activities not less and certainly not so many activities taken out which greatly impact the replayability after the story ends.What about the Driving School you ask? Gone. The Bike School? Gone. Only the Flying School survived.Races remember those? The ones available in this game have small intro cutscenes that again were copied and pasted straight out of Need For Speed Most Wanted. Except that Most Wanted... heck even SA had a lot more races. I keep wondering how much time was wasted on that that could've been spent on more races. I could say that about most of this game in fact. You have plenty of races in Online though... but I paid for a solid singleplayer experience not a single/multiplayer hybrid. Speaking of Online the Online portion will be covered in the comments section of this review. There's a character limit I was unaware of.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There are some great things about this game however some parts suck. I'll go over what is great about the game. The story mode is awesome. Such a good story and I would recommend to anyone that you play it. The only thing the single player mode lacks is DLC. It would be cool if Rockstar created some single player DLC like in Grand Theft Auto IV. Now onto the bad stuff. The online is pretty terrible now. It used to quite fun but now Rockstar have just made everything so expensive now and added some pretty ridiculous things. The only way anyone can progress is purchasing a shark card or getting modded money. It's a shame because in the first couple of years GTA Online was really enjoyable. Overall I'd still recommend this game due to how great the single player is however playing the online mode may disappoint you. At 24.99 ($29.99) it's still worth a buy. Even better if you get it on sale.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: An overall very enjoyable single player and experience but as the online got increadibly popular Rockstar basically put ALL their attention onto online and we haven t seen a single player update pretty much ever. Enjoyable but severely flawed I hope they add something to single player or we ll just have to wait for GTA 6

review: EDIT As of June 24 2017 Take Two has brought back OpenIV. However they have said that they can still remove it. Either way GTA Online is still plagued with the issues stated below and makes GTA V deserve a thumbs down. However if you want to buy this game for modding or for the singleplayer then GTA V deserves a thumbs up.If I had written this review months ago it would have easily gotten a thumbs up. Now the game has gone to complete garbage. I still would have given it a thumbs up but Take Two decided act like a child and forcefully end the support of OpenIV for modding in GTA V. This program has let users such as I use and make mods such as LSPDR and The Flash for the single player versions of Rockstar games for almost a decade. Now it is being taken away for no apparent reason other than the bs excuse of "Hacking." Because of that act alone GTA V deserves a thumb down in protest.However if that was not the case GTA V suffers from a terrible multiplayer only powered by greedy developers. Don't get me wrong the single player in this game is a 10/10 alone but the crappy "GTA Online" is a pay to win sh tstorm filled with hackers that get away with ruining the game because Rockstar does not try to fix the issue. Instead they push out these crappy DLC updates to the multiplayer which only make it harder and harder for a legitimate player to do well. This is not even an exaggeration. Without paying for stupid shark cards with real money or hacking the game there is no way to actually make GTA cash on a sane basis.Grinding for hours for the game is literally impossible because of terrible matchmaking system this game has. Even if you fully load into singleplayer and then try to load into online it can take ten minutes (on a good day). Each place in this game has a loading screen and unintuitive menu to pass through before even getting to the meat of the game. Once you do the hackers bombard with money and you either get banned or have your progess reset.For all of the complaints listed above GTA V gets nothing more than a thumbs down. Take Two may have been the one that finally pushed the nail into the coffin but you Rockstar were the ones that put it there in the first place. Fix your game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V This is my review of gta v. it is my opinion and yours my be diffrent to mine. i will start off with saying gta v is an open world game with limitless things to do both online and offline. The story is fun and is something you want to invest in with you feeling fully part of it. 90% of the missions are fun and youw will want to play them again but 10% is just a grind do to wanting to end it soon. The online is a fun experience to play with friends but if you dont have any friends who own GTA V its not as good as it could be. playing privet servers with friends is recommended by me as although it is not as common as people make out hackers can be annoying although most of them just do fun stuff.Pros Good storyline Amazing graphics Never gets boring and is constentally updated having online friend partys is fun huge map with diffrent parts to it makes it feel diverse mini games are the bestCons Hackersservers are not the most stable in the world but there decentthe in game talk is a bit broken but just use discord or teamspeak the combat system could be better ing russiansConclusion/ personal opinion GTA V Is a really fun game that you should buy if you re into open world shooters. the story is good and online is fun with friends. if the game is on sale for 25 you hsould highly concider buying.

review: The game is and so are the people making it. In general it's a massive grind to basically milk as much money as they can with work only being putting into making more money and not into improving the game. One feature that they implimented was making it so you cant report anyone more than once every few minutes so even while in a lobby with a group of hackers all actively discussing what hacks they are using and etc they limit your reporting to once every few minutes rather than actually adressing the issue of hackers. Instead of allowing you to experience online mode hacker free with friends or with your crew you won't be able to do any of the tasks that are a part of the main forms of income. And while it may be busted to let people grind them safe from the griefing of other players whats more busted is the rampant hackers permeating online as well as that combined with that the game is too grindy to function and so people aren't playing the game. Because they have to do an extreme ing grind doing menial in friends only pay a bunch of ing money or just deal with cancerous hackers. The single player in this game is really good and you will really love the characters especially the crazy Trevor and how they work together to make the most money they can while also trying to deal with the feds in the problems with Los Santos. Really is a great sequel to San Andreas and it is a very enjoyable experience. Same goes with the multiplayer at least at the beginning stages it gets a lot of fun but after playing for so long it kinda gets boring and you really don t have anything left once you have everything. Though they do free updates that sometimes do encourage the communty to have fun with the game so Rcomstar does good in that. In general it s an awesome game to buy especially on sale.

review: Full disclosure I'm old. I really enjoyed GTA II but wasn't a fan of the gratuitous violence in the series as I got older. A friend of mine convinced me to pick up GTA V he didn't have any other friends that played it was on sale and to be fair there's a lot of entertaining content available.It's for this reason that I feel genuinely bad for all of the developers and designers that put hard work into this game. The effort really shows and it has a lot of redeeming qualities. Somewhere along the way (I'm assuming pretty early on) this game became about one thing making money at the expense of everything else.A key business metric for GTA V surfaces very very quickly maximize the number of players in public sessions. It's unwieldy and not very intuitive to setup and maintain your own private session and the moment something goes wrong you're kicked back into a public session. While that might seem reasonable "goes wrong" has a very loose definition in this case. Most of the missions require more people than I care to play with and if someone dies or leaves at the last second I'm forced to start over. And over. And over.Even though I purchased content I'm not allowed to run certain missions in a private session. You already took my money don't make me play with the motley crowd please.This brings me to my next point. While playing with a friend and driving around in one of the neat cars I purchased my teammate steps out of the vehicle and immediately dies to someone that isn't even in the same hemisphere as us. I assumed he was being dramatic when he said that there was a hacker/modder in our session but the death toll kept climbing as the seconds ticked by. People began to chat about a modder in the session then suddenly for no reason I started to receive money while standing in place.I was astounded. Cheating is *so* prevalent in this game that it was immediately recognized by everyone in the session. Something similar happened three more times in the same night.Despite the obvious quality of this game it's very clearly being run by people that don't give a flying f*** about the experience of the players. The business model seems to be sell as much DLC as possible don't let people play the content that they payed for in private sessions do your best to force people online and then spend *zero* effort to make the game secure from people that get their kicks from ruining the enjoyment of others.Again I'm old so I don't experience disillusionment very much these days but I was sorely disappointed to see one of the most enduring and recognizable franchises in the industry brought to its knees by greed and the juvenile whims of 12 year olds.What the hell Rockstar? What the hell.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Overall It's an amazing game wouldn't recommend to the younger audience but it is a really good game and has aged as good as it could have in the time it has been out. But that was my review on the story mode. The online mode is way to broken. To many modders and other people who just want to screw with you in any way that they can but the online mode can be fun as well. If you get yourself into a public lobby with only yourself in it you can earn money pretty fast and easy even if someone else joins that person may or may not want to screw with you but it would probably still be fun due to the fact that you wont be alone in the server and you'll have someone to compete with to get better at the game and have a better understanding of how the game works. So in conclusion the game is a good game and I would recommend to people who enjoy a good story line and a competitive online mode if you do start hating the game just get into a public lobby by yourself look it up on Youtube if you don't know how to do it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There's a reason this game is selling so cheap. It used to be amazing until Rockstar got greedy and started manipulating the game in order to extract more money from it. All of the recent upgrades are nothing more than a money grab from the company rather than a legitimate effort to make the game better. They claim they turned off porting accounts to combat "hacked consoles" but in reality it's their greed that motivated this. It's simply easier and cheaper to punish everyone rather than to spend the money to patch the exploits and to punish the people breaking the rules. It's super convenient that making a player start over also makes them money if they don't want to grind through and buy a shark card eh? Typical arrogant "if we our customer we win" thinking. The entire GTA series had it's day but those days are long over. It's just tired and boring now. They should probably drop the "open world" bit too. It's just a big map. Open world implies that it's much larger and it takes no time at all to fly across this tiny island in a jet. Typical marketing speak from people who likely aren't even interested in games. With the real VR open worlds out there where you can do more than just consume content and shoot at people their description falls flat. Save your $14.99. With what those idiots are doing to this game every update it probably won't even be worth downloading when it eventually becomes free.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Trees and BUSHES are appearently more undestructible than a truck insurgent fences2. Why wont they update story mode with new vehicles? The only way to get a decent amount of money is to play 24/7 or buy sharkcards that are overpriced AF but i still buy them to not get blowed upp by Oppressors everywhere.Oppressor MK 2 i mean the first one was OP enough but they decided to add another one.4. Rockstar game services unavailable i have checked my internet and it has a very good connection but it still says this sometimes when im going into a race or mission.5. Npcs they drive STRAIGHT into you if they get the chance i drive straight they turn left towards me so i crash in them and its 12.000 $ from the vehicle cargo.6. The Cops If THEY drive into YOU you get the cops after you stand still infront of them they're after you call lester to lose them 1 minute later they're after you for nothing. They are after you for stealing 1 CAR i mean its logical but its GTA nothing in GTA is logical (Flying cars flying bikes and undestructible bushes)7. Spawn locations i was killed by aimbot NPCs and i respawned on an island... I couldnt call Merrywheater for pickups or anything like that so i was forced to swim for 20 mins.8. But i STILL play it i think this game deserves new developers R* wont care about fixing this "Rockstar game services are currently down try again later" problem they just wait for the sharkcard money to roll in when they still have millions that are buying the game and they wont change the prices on sharkcards YES im pretty mad at this game at this point no Call me salty kid all you want but this game is just more t than good like 60% of the time.

review: The review is simple games are absolutely good games no doubt but a good game is a failure of bad operations.I would like to talk about the plug in problem some people say this problem is to blame those who open right they are the source.Everything has a source just like everything has both good and bad sides the world tells us that it is foolish to go to the source.We try to compare the people who are hanging out to the bad guys and in this world or in a society it's impossible to be short of bad guys because there's always a source.Let's just think is there any country in the world that can prevent bad people from being born?There is noSo what is everybody doing yeah trying to figure out how to deal with to limit to pass the constitution to pass the criminal law all kinds of things that can have an inhibitory effect and actually do something about itBut I feel like Rockstar didn't do it maybe they didn't have the ability to do it or they like a lot of players put the onus on the sourceBut oneself is through "random" seal the decision such as number to stop the plug in phenomenon time will tell you this does not useI would say that no matter what award GTA V wins how much money it makes how big an achievement it is in the history of gamingBut one way to go down to death then this is a failure of the game这个评论很简单 游戏绝对是好游戏 毋庸置疑的 可是 一款好游戏却败在了不好的运营之下 我要说的就是外挂问题 有人说 这个问题该去怪那些开挂的人 对的 他们是源头 任何事情都有源头 就像任何东西都有好与坏两方面 这个世界告诉我们追究源头是愚蠢的做法 我们尝试把那些开挂的人比作坏人 在这个世界 或一个社会都不可能缺少坏人 因为总会有源头 我们不妨想想 这个世界上有任何一个国家可以让坏人无法产生吗 没有那大家都在做什么 没错 都在想办法应对 限制 通过宪法 刑法各种可以产生抑制效果的东西 并付出实际行动但我感觉Rockstar并没有做到 也许他们没有能力做到 或者他们和很多玩家一样 把责任全抛给了源头而自己则是通过 随机 封号这样的决策来制止外挂现象 时间会告诉你 这并没有用我想说 无论GTA V获得什么奖项 赚了多少钱 成为游戏历史上多大的成就也好但一条路走下去走到死 那么这就是一个失败的游戏

review: This game is a masterpiece don't get me wrong. But something broke along the great road of success with rockstar. They noticed that they could milk money out of GTA V completely ignoring the community making it harder for them to gain money and ignoring the things the COMMUNITY wants. Developers have been known to do this but not to the extent of rockstar. They don't do jack about the modders. They despite belief do ban but the shear amount of them is too much. We are screaming at them to get dedicated servers but they choose to ignore us. Thus FiveM was born the roleplaying delight. If you have GTA but your sick of the hackers modders toxic community etc. Go to FiveM. Now GTAO has sparked many good moments for me. But rockstar keeps taking 1 step forward and 2 steps back. If you like previous GTA games but you're on the edge of buying it. Don't. This is not the same game as the previous in the series. It is too expensive for what you get for an aged game.

review: After few days playing this game I found out that this is one of the most interesting GTA games ever. In my perspective there are pros and cons.StoryWell... I can't describe it but a combo of real life situations such as family problems and a bank heist setup is just awesome. Nothing to say.VehiclesA lot of new vehicles have been introduced in this game and unlike previous one (GTA IV) this has over more than 400 vehicles to be offered either offline or online. It also brings back the airplanes functionality as in San Andreas.To bring back the vehicles from the previous one (GTA IV) you have to use mods (see Modding Capability).CameraFirst Person Perspective (FPP) was not my preferrence at start but since there's an achievement for it I did it for more than a day play time. The FPP camera is just awesome like... this is like when I play some of the First Person Shooter (FPS) games. Even the fighter jets and combat helicopters in FPP also featuring simple version of Joint Helmet Mounted Cueing System (JHMCS) with airspeed and altitude indicator just like in flight simulator games.Online FeaturePeople talk about cheaters and yes there are too many. I've encountered one along my way and I chose not to interfere just to be on a safe side. And if I lose the RGSC account because of cheating (even though it wasn't me) not only I lose access to multiplayer (GTA Online) but also the singleplayer so that my modding freedom is at risk (see Modding Capability).Modding CapabilityMyself's a long time modder before I have this game and I also made several mods. Come to think of it this game has a ton of stability that makes this game safe for modding of any kind like adding new vehicles people... you name it. I tried more than 100+ different mods and they work without any negative drawbacks. However mods and going online didn't go too well so it's meant only for singleplayer mode.My current PC specification when applied with a lot of mods can cause FPS drop to maybe 15 or 10 depending on the complexity and type of the mod.AnimationBasic animations are much more enhanced than previous GTA game but there's a con on the weapons animation especially the shotgun animation. I found the Pump Shotgun and Sawn off Shotgun animations are quite weird because every time you reload you just put in a shotgun shell and it while in a real life you put in how much it can load into a barrel before you can use it. Previous one was about 2 shells when you reload. I found it really unrealistic if being compared with FPS games such as Call of Duty but hey this is a video game. What can you expect?OtherI'm taking into an account that the environment of the game was good. Place of setting was more or less same to the real Los Angeles city although I never visited that city in real life. Vehicle physics was quite good although from some video titles on YouTube previous one was better than this despite negative drawbacks on that. The game's an open world and you can do anything about it. In singleplayer mode (after finishing all story missions) I prefer to get chased by 50 police officers and shoot them and to do that I prefer not to kill too many civilians. Other than that is loitering buying property meeting strangers or met some random guy in GTA Online. Most of them I met preferred to pick a fight if in freeroam mode no matter who is friend or foe.In conclusion this game is a symbol of good gesture for all GTA lovers like me although like I said there are pros and cons. With the announcement of GTA VI come near I hope it can be improved better than this one.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Take Two has had a rough go with this game but I think it's the better for it. What we have now is a great single player open world game attached to one of the best sandboxes that exists today where you can mess around with friends! Constantly getting free updates that add new ways to play and earn money although some grinding will be required for the more expensive items.How to deal with hackers Find a new lobbySeriously though this game has an amazing single player campaign and buying it just for that is well worth it. I think a lot of people let their entire review live and die on GTA Online. While it has bugs hackers and can require lots of grinding if you don't pay for the GTA$ it is not without it's many upsides.Even after 3 years many of the major gamebreaking bugs that pop up once in a blue moon are quickly squashed by Rockstar. They have diverted work from GTA VI for this game and continue to pump out DLC and quality of life updates that give people new races weapons and vehicles. Hackers are a big problem but if you suspect someone to be hacking report them and move on. No point in waiting around for them to drap cash on you getting you banned. And as for the of the game if you are not wanting to play CEO or MC missions then go passive mode or have fun fighting them. Play that part of the game. And if not then find a new lobby. Plain and simple. Yes it can be a pain but it's better than giving them the satisfaction and you the anger.This game sure as hell isnt perfect but people become so entitled that they don't see that there are plenty of ways to enjoy the game they just choose not to.Stay safe )

review: Voice acting is superb. Animations are very good. Online and let's be honest you really want to play this online You struggle to make any money at all when you're starting so you either buy shark cards with real money to get the literally millions of dollars you need to actually set up businesses to make money or...you never ever make enough money to actually start making money. At $20 cash per million you can expect to pay hundreds to set up businesses. Now once you actually have millions of dollars you can be like all the cool kids and buy a rocket firing flying car which allows you to breeze through missions. Don't worry though if you manage to get enough money to start your own cash making business which literally takes HOURS to make any product for you to sell be it guns drugs whatever...then the fun really begins because now you need to be on a public server to actually drive the goods to market. At which point those kids with rocket firing flying cars get bonuses for killing you and destroying your goods. So much fun can't possibly fit into one game.Oh yeah and lets not forget the "loading" screen which at the best of times takes several minutes every time you start a mission end a mission start a match end a match. I put in 70 hours online and probably spend at least 10 hours looking at loading screens and apparently that's typical. Story mode offline Sure this one is fantastic. But your solo play doesn't interest Rockstar because you aren't buying shark cards with cash and that's really where the expected to make their money. The game itself is fantastic with a massive open world you can explore dozens of vehicles to drive and fly thousands of npc's to punch in the face. Hundreds of hours of fun. It could be thousands of hours of fun if they stopped catering to that 1% of gamers who got picked on as kids and now live to lord their in game superiority over those little people by shooting every other player with rockets from their flying cars. I would be lying if I saw anyone over level 300 who wasn't simply killing other players for fun because that's the only kind of person who sticks with this game online.

review: OnlineI mostly play GTA Online and I am always having a lot of fun but beware there are a lot of hostile unfriendly and destructive players that will try to ruin your gameplay by destroying your vehicles constantly killing you screwing up your missions etc however there are people who wants to help and play the game like you make sure you don't waste that opportunity add them as friends!Weekly updatesRockstar updates GTA Online every week and there's almost always new content to enjoy when you get to chance to get online. There is diversity meaning that there's stuff for everyone to enjoy whether you're in to muscle cars RC (remote control) stuff or PvP.Week long promotionsWith every update comes a promotion. It could double up your nightclub income make CEO work twice as profitable or discounted prices on MKII weaponry that gives you the perfect opportunity to expand your gun locker!GameplayThis game is very grindy and you must spend numerous hours grinding for money so you can afford all the weapons and vehicles that you want. Grinding gets tedious quite fast but that is being helped quite a bit with the weekly promotions as previously mentioned.VerdictDo you like to grind games? Then this game is for you.Do you like to play a game where other players may or may not screw up your mission? Then this game is for you.Do you like to kill stuff? Then this game is for you.Do you like to customise cars? Then this game is for you.Cheers
